00060 /*!*****************************************************************************
00061  *******************************************************************************
00062  \note  sign
00063  \date  02/25/91
00064  
00065  \remarks 
00066  
00067  calculates the SIGN function
00068  
00069  *******************************************************************************
00070  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00071  
00072  \param[in]     expr : argument for SIGN
00073  return : SIGN(expr)
00074  
00075  ******************************************************************************/
00076 double
00077 sign(double expr)
00078 {
00079   if (expr > 0)
00080     return (1.0);
00081   else
00082     if (expr < 0)
00083       return (-1.0);
00084     else
00085       return (0.0);
00086 }

00089 /*!*****************************************************************************
00090  *******************************************************************************
00091  \note  get_double
00092  \date  02/25/91
00093  
00094  \remarks 
00095  
00096  get (double) value, offer default value
00097  
00098  *******************************************************************************
00099  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00100  
00101  \param[in]     comment          : character comment dislayed with input inquiry
00102  \param[in]     defaultvalue    : default value dislayed with input inquiry
00103  \param[out]    value            : value the user typed in. value = defaultvalue if the
00104                       user did not type in anything
00105  
00106  ******************************************************************************/
00107 int
00108 get_double(char *comment, double defaultvalue, double *value)
00109 {
00110   int                           i, c, goon;
00111   char                          string[100];
00112 
00113   for (i = 0; i < 100; ++i)
00114     string[i] = '\0';
00115 
00116   printf("%s [%.5f]: ", comment,defaultvalue);
00117   goon = TRUE;
00118   for (i = 0; (c = getchar()) != '\n'; ++i) {
00119     if (c == ' ')
00120       goon = FALSE;
00121     if (goon) {
00122       string[i] = c;
00123     }
00124   }
00125 
00126   if (string[0] == 'q' && i == 1)
00127     return FALSE;
00128 
00129   if (i > 0)
00130     sscanf(string, "%lf", &*value);
00131   else
00132     *value = defaultvalue;
00133 
00134   return TRUE;
00135 
00136 
00137 }

00282 /*!*****************************************************************************
00283  *******************************************************************************
00284  \note  atan2_save
00285  \date  11/10/91
00286  
00287  \remarks 
00288  
00289  calculates the atan of y/x by obeying the singularities of this
00290  function
00291  
00292  *******************************************************************************
00293  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00294  
00295  \param[in]     x : denominator for fraction
00296  \param[in]     y : numerator for fraction
00297  
00298  ******************************************************************************/
00299 #define ATAN2_THRES 1.e-6
00300 double
00301 atan2_save(double x, double y)
00302 {
00303 
00304   if (fabs(x) < ATAN2_THRES && fabs(y) < ATAN2_THRES)
00305     return 0.0;
00306 
00307   if (fabs(x) < ATAN2_THRES) {
00308     if (y >= 0)
00309       return (double) (PI / 2.0);
00310     else
00311       return (double) (3.0 * PI / 2.0);
00312   }
00313   if (fabs(y) < ATAN2_THRES) {
00314     if (x >= 0)
00315       return (double) (0.0);
00316     else
00317       return (double) (PI);
00318   }
00319 
00320   return atan2(y,x);
00321 
00322 }

00324 /*!*****************************************************************************
00325  *******************************************************************************
00326  \note  gaussian
00327  \date  August 17, 92
00328  
00329  \remarks 
00330  
00331  randomly adds Gaussian noise to a given value
00332  the noise level is interpreted as the 99% cutoff of the gaussian
00333  
00334  *******************************************************************************
00335  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00336  
00337  \param[in]     value           : value to which the noise should be added
00338  \param[in]     std            : the standard deviation of the gaussian noise
00339  
00340  ******************************************************************************/
00341 double
00342 gaussian(double value, double std)
00343      
00344 {
00345 
00346   static int firsttime = TRUE;
00347   double     temp;
00348   int        seed=1;
00349 
00350   if (std == 0)
00351     return value;
00352 
00353   /* intitialize the random function with an arbitrary number */
00354 
00355   if (firsttime) {
00356     firsttime = FALSE;
00357     seed = -abs(((int) time(NULL)) % MY_RAND_MAX);
00358   }
00359 
00360   /* get me a value from my_gasdev, 
00361      which is normal distributed about 0, var=1 */
00362 
00363   temp = my_gasdev(&seed)*std;
00364 
00365   return (value + temp);
00366 
00367 }

00369 /*!*****************************************************************************
00370  *******************************************************************************
00371  \note  uniform
00372  \date  11/10/91
00373  
00374  \remarks 
00375  
00376  randomly adds noise to a given value
00377  
00378  *******************************************************************************
00379  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00380  
00381  \param[in]     value           : value to which the noise should be added
00382  \param[in]     std            : the standard deviation of the noise
00383 
00384  NOTE: the std of a uniform distribution is sqrt(1/3)*|a| where
00385        a is half the interval of where the data is supposed to come
00386        from
00387  
00388  ******************************************************************************/
00389 double
00390 uniform(double value, double std)
00391 {
00392 
00393   static  int firsttime = TRUE;
00394   int     seed=1;
00395   double  aux;
00396   time_t  t;
00397   double  misc;
00398 
00399   if (std == 0)
00400     return value;
00401 
00402   /* intitialize the random function with an arbitrary number */
00403 
00404   if (firsttime) {
00405     firsttime = FALSE;
00406     seed = -abs(((int) time(NULL)) % MY_RAND_MAX);
00407   }
00408 
00409   /* the inteval size for the given std must be: */
00410 
00411   aux = sqrt(3.0*sqr(std));
00412 
00413   misc = (my_ran0(&seed)-0.5)/0.5*aux; 
00414 
00415   return value + misc;
00416 }

00418 /*!*****************************************************************************
00419  *******************************************************************************
00420  \note  random_number
00421  \date  06/05/92
00422  
00423  \remarks 
00424  
00425  generates a random number in the range of the given values. The result
00426  is a random integer number. This integer has equal probability for the
00427  entire given interval.
00428  
00429  *******************************************************************************
00430  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00431  
00432  \param[in]     upper           : upper bound
00433  \param[in]     lower           : lower bound
00434  
00435  ******************************************************************************/
00436 long
00437 random_number(long upper, long lower)
00438 {
00439   double        aux1, aux2;
00440   long          val;
00441 
00442   if (lower > upper) {          /* just a safety check */
00443     aux1 = upper;
00444     upper = lower;
00445     lower = aux1;
00446   }
00447   
00448   aux1 = uniform(0.0,0.2887)+0.5; /* this is a number in [0,1] */
00449   val  = (long) (aux1*(upper-lower+1)-1.e-10) + lower;
00450 
00451   if (val > upper)
00452     val = upper;
00453   if (val < lower)
00454     val = lower;
00455   
00456 
00457   return val;
00458 }

00470  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00471  
00472  \param[in]     prob            : probability for TRUE
00473  
00474  ******************************************************************************/
00475 int
00476 prob_experiment(double prob)
00477 {
00478 
00479   int i=1, n;
00480   double aux;
00481 
00482   aux = uniform(0.0,0.2887)+(prob-0.5);
00483   if (aux > 0)
00484     return TRUE;
00485   else
00486     return FALSE;
00487 }

00489 /*!*****************************************************************************
00490  *******************************************************************************
00491  \note  start_calloc_track
00492  \date  March 2006
00493  
00494  \remarks 
00495  
00496  stops tracking of calloc pointers
00497  
00498  *******************************************************************************
00499  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00500  
00501  \param[in]     max_track         : max elements to be trackeed
00502  \param[out]    trackptr         : ptr to array of calloc pointers
00503  
00504  returns FALSE is unsuccessful
00505  
00506  ******************************************************************************/
00507 int
00508 start_calloc_track(int max_track, void ***ptr)
00509 {
00510 
00511   if (track_calloc) {
00512     printf("Warning: calloc track list was initated while other track active\n");
00513   }
00514 
00515   track_list = calloc(max_track+1,sizeof(void *));
00516   if (track_list == NULL)
00517     return FALSE;
00518 
00519   track_calloc     = TRUE;
00520   max_track_calloc = max_track;
00521   n_track_calloc   = 0;
00522   track_list[0]    = (void *) 0;
00523   *ptr             = track_list;
00524 
00525   return TRUE;
00526 
00527 }

00550 /*!*****************************************************************************
00551  *******************************************************************************
00552  \note  free_calloc_track
00553  \date  March 2006
00554  
00555  \remarks 
00556  
00557  frees memory accumulated in the a calloc track list, including the track
00558  list itself.
00559  
00560  *******************************************************************************
00561  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00562  
00563  \param[in]     ptr : pointer to track list
00564  
00565  ******************************************************************************/
00566 void
00567 free_calloc_track(void **ptr)
00568 {
00569   unsigned long i;
00570 
00571   for (i=(unsigned long)ptr[0]; i>=1; --i)
00572     free(ptr[i]);
00573   free((void *)ptr);
00574 
00575 }

00577 /*!*****************************************************************************
00578  *******************************************************************************
00579  \note  my_calloc
00580  \date  August 17, 92
00581  
00582  \remarks 
00583  
00584  does the same as calloc, just includes message handling
00585  
00586  *******************************************************************************
00587  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00588  
00589  \param[in]     number            : how many elements are to be allocated
00590  \param[in]     length            : what is the size of the elements
00591  \param[in]     flag              : is MY_STOP if failure of calloc shall result in program
00592  exit, is MY_CONTINUE if program shall go on.
00593  
00594  returns NULL like calloc is unsuccessful
00595  
00596  ******************************************************************************/
00597 void *
00598 my_calloc(size_t number, size_t length, int flag)
00599 
00600 {
00601   void  *rc;
00602 
00603   rc = my_calloc_track(number,length);
00604   if (rc == NULL) {
00605 
00606     printf("No more memory in calloc! Increase application size.\n");
00607     printf("Hit return to continue ...\n");
00608     getchar();
00609 
00610     if (flag == MY_STOP)
00611       exit(-1);
00612   }
00613 
00614   return (rc);
00615 
00616 }
00617 /*!*****************************************************************************
00618  *******************************************************************************
00619  \note  my_calloc_track
00620  \date  August 17, 92
00621  
00622  \remarks 
00623  
00624  does the same as calloc, just keeps track of every pointer that was
00625  allocated
00626  
00627  *******************************************************************************
00628  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00629  
00630  \param[in]     number            : how many elements are to be allocated
00631  \param[in]     length            : what is the size of the elements
00632  
00633  returns NULL like calloc is unsuccessful
00634  
00635  ******************************************************************************/
00636 void *
00637 my_calloc_track(size_t number, size_t length)
00638 
00639 {
00640   void  *rc;
00641 
00642   rc = calloc(number,length);
00643 
00644   if (rc != NULL && track_calloc) {
00645     if (n_track_calloc < max_track_calloc) {
00646       track_list[++n_track_calloc] = rc;
00647       track_list[0] = (void *) n_track_calloc;
00648     } else {
00649       printf("calloc track list is exhausted (n_track_calloc=%li vs. %i=max_track_calloc)\n",
00650              n_track_calloc,max_track_calloc);
00651     }
00652   }
00653 
00654   return (rc);
00655 
00656 }

00658 /*!*****************************************************************************
00659  *******************************************************************************
00660  \note  mat_mult
00661  \date  August 17, 92
00662  
00663  \remarks 
00664  
00665  multiplies two arbitrary (compatible) matrices a * b
00666 
00667  *******************************************************************************
00668  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00669 
00670  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
00671  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
00672  \param[out]    c                : result of multipliciation
00673 
00674  ******************************************************************************/
00675 int
00676 mat_mult(Matrix a, Matrix b, Matrix c)
00677 {
00678   int      i,j,m;
00679   Matrix   temp;
00680   int      ar,ac,br,bc;
00681   int      type;
00682 
00683   ar = a[0][NR];
00684   ac = a[0][NC];
00685 
00686   br = b[0][NR];
00687   bc = b[0][NC];
00688 
00689   if (ac != br) {
00690     printf("Incompatile matrices in >mat_mult<\n");
00691     return FALSE;
00692   }
00693 
00694   /* bugfix (adsouza 07/07/2002)
00695   if (c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG && 
00696       !(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG && b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG)) {
00697     printf("Incompatile matrices in >mat_mult<: need full matric for c\n");
00698     return FALSE;
00699   }
00700   end of old code */
00701   if ((c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_SYMM) && 
00702       !(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG && b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG)) {
00703     printf("Incompatile matrices in >mat_mult<: need full matric for c\n");
00704     return FALSE;
00705   }
00706   /* end of new code for bugfix */
00707 
00708   /* check whether input and output matrices are different */
00709   
00710   if (a == c || b == c) {
00711     if (c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG) {
00712       temp = my_matrix_diag(1,ar,1,bc);
00713     } else {
00714       temp = my_matrix(1,ar,1,bc);
00715     }
00716   } else {
00717     temp = c;
00718   }
00719 
00720   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE]*10+b[0][MAT_TYPE];
00721 
00722   switch (type) {
00723 
00724   case FULL_FULL:
00725   
00726     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00727       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
00728         temp[i][j]=0;
00729         for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
00730           temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[m][j];
00731         }
00732       }
00733     }
00734 
00735     break;
00736 
00737   case FULL_DIAG:
00738 
00739     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00740       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
00741         temp[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[j][j];
00742       }
00743     }
00744 
00745     break;
00746 
00747 
00748   case FULL_SYMM:
00749 
00750     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00751       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
00752         temp[i][j]=0;
00753         for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
00754           if (m <= j) {
00755             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[m][j];
00756           } else {
00757             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[j][m];
00758           }
00759         }
00760       }
00761     }
00762 
00763     break;
00764 
00765 
00766   case DIAG_FULL:
00767 
00768     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00769       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
00770         temp[i][j] = a[i][i]*b[i][j];
00771       }
00772     }
00773 
00774     break;
00775 
00776 
00777   case DIAG_DIAG:
00778 
00779     if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG) {
00780       for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00781         temp[i][i] = a[i][i]*b[i][i];
00782       }
00783     } else {
00784       for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00785         for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
00786           if (i == j) {
00787             temp[i][i] = a[i][i]*b[i][i];
00788           } else {
00789             temp[i][j] = 0.0;
00790             if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
00791               temp[j][i] = 0.0;
00792           }
00793         }
00794       }
00795     }
00796 
00797     break;
00798 
00799 
00800   case DIAG_SYMM:
00801 
00802     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00803       for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
00804         temp[i][j] = a[i][i]*b[i][j];
00805         if (i!=j)
00806           /*temp[j][i] = a[j][j]*b[j][i];*/  /*bugfix (adsouza 07/07/2002)*/
00807           temp[j][i] = a[j][j]*b[i][j];
00808       }
00809     }
00810 
00811     break;
00812 
00813 
00814   case SYMM_FULL:
00815 
00816     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00817       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
00818         temp[i][j]=0;
00819         for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
00820           if (i<=m) {
00821             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[m][j];
00822           } else {
00823             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[m][j];
00824           }
00825         }
00826       }
00827     }
00828 
00829     break;
00830 
00831 
00832   case SYMM_DIAG:
00833 
00834     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00835       for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
00836         temp[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[j][j];
00837         if (i!=j)
00838           /*temp[j][i] = a[j][i]*b[i][i];*/ /*bugfix (adsouza 07/07/2002)*/
00839           temp[j][i] = a[i][j]*b[i][i];
00840       }
00841     }
00842 
00843     break;
00844 
00845 
00846   case SYMM_SYMM:
00847 
00848     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00849       for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
00850         temp[i][j]=temp[j][i]=0.0;
00851         for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
00852           if (i<=m && m<=j) {
00853             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[m][j];
00854             if (i!=j)
00855               temp[j][i] += b[i][m] * a[m][j];
00856           } else if (i<=m && m > j) {
00857             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[j][m];
00858             if (i!=j)
00859               temp[j][i] += b[i][m] * a[j][m];
00860           } else if (i>m && m <= j) {
00861             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[m][j];
00862             if (i!=j)
00863               temp[j][i] += b[m][i] * a[m][j];
00864           } else {
00865             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[j][m];
00866             if (i!=j)
00867               temp[j][i] += b[m][i] * a[j][m];
00868           }
00869         }
00870       }
00871     }
00872 
00873     break;
00874 
00875     
00876   default:
00877 
00878     exit(-12);
00879 
00880   }
00881   
00882   if (a == c || b == c) {
00883     mat_equal(temp,c);
00884     my_free_matrix(temp,1,ar,1,bc);
00885   }
00886 
00887   return TRUE;
00888   
00889 }
00890 
00891 /*!*****************************************************************************
00892  *******************************************************************************
00893  \note  mat_mult_normal_transpose
00894  \date  July 05, 2002
00895  
00896  \remarks 
00897  
00898  multiplies two arbitrary (compatible) matrices a * b' (i.e. a with the
00899  transpose of b)
00900 
00901  *******************************************************************************
00902  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00903 
00904  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
00905  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
00906  \param[out]    c                : result of multipliciation
00907 
00908  ******************************************************************************/
00909 int
00910 mat_mult_normal_transpose(Matrix a, Matrix b, Matrix c)
00911 {
00912   int      i,j,m;
00913   Matrix   temp;
00914   int      ar,ac,br,bc;
00915   int      type;
00916 
00917   ar = a[0][NR];
00918   ac = a[0][NC];
00919 
00920   br = b[0][NR];
00921   bc = b[0][NC];
00922 
00923   if (ac != bc) {
00924     printf("Incompatile matrices in >mat_mult_normal_transpose<\n");
00925     return FALSE;
00926   }
00927 
00928   if ((c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_SYMM) && 
00929       !(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG && b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG)) {
00930     printf("Incompatile matrices in >mat_mult_normal_transpose<: need full matrix for c\n");
00931     return FALSE;
00932   }
00933   
00934   /* check whether input and output matrices are different */
00935   
00936   if (a == c || b == c) {
00937     if (c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG) {
00938       temp = my_matrix_diag(1,ar,1,br);
00939     } else {
00940       temp = my_matrix(1,ar,1,br);
00941     }
00942   } else {
00943     temp = c;
00944   }
00945 
00946   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE]*10+b[0][MAT_TYPE];
00947 
00948   switch (type) {
00949 
00950   case FULL_FULL:
00951   
00952     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00953       for (j=1; j <= br; ++j){
00954         temp[i][j]=0;
00955         for (m=1; m <= bc; ++m){
00956           temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[j][m];
00957         }
00958       }
00959     }
00960 
00961     break;
00962 
00963   case FULL_DIAG:
00964 
00965     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00966       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
00967         temp[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[j][j];
00968       }
00969     }
00970 
00971     break;
00972 
00973 
00974   case FULL_SYMM:
00975 
00976     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00977       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
00978         temp[i][j]=0;
00979         for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
00980           if (m <= j) {
00981             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[m][j];
00982           } else {
00983             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[j][m];
00984           }
00985         }
00986       }
00987     }
00988 
00989     break;
00990 
00991 
00992   case DIAG_FULL:
00993 
00994     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
00995       for (j=1; j <= br; ++j){
00996         temp[i][j] = a[i][i]*b[j][i];
00997       }
00998     }
00999 
01000     break;
01001 
01002 
01003   case DIAG_DIAG:
01004 
01005     if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG) {
01006       for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01007         temp[i][i] = a[i][i]*b[i][i];
01008       }
01009     } else {
01010       for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01011         for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
01012           if (i == j) {
01013             temp[i][i] = a[i][i]*b[i][i];
01014           } else {
01015             temp[i][j] = 0.0;
01016             if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
01017               temp[j][i] = 0.0;
01018           }
01019         }
01020       }
01021     }
01022 
01023     break;
01024 
01025 
01026   case DIAG_SYMM:
01027 
01028     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01029       for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
01030         temp[i][j] = a[i][i]*b[i][j];
01031         if (i!=j)
01032           temp[j][i] = a[j][j]*b[i][j];
01033       }
01034     }
01035 
01036     break;
01037 
01038 
01039   case SYMM_FULL:
01040 
01041     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01042       for (j=1; j <= br; ++j){
01043         temp[i][j]=0;
01044         for (m=1; m <= bc; ++m){
01045           if (i<=m) {
01046             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[j][m];
01047           } else {
01048             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[j][m];
01049           }
01050         }
01051       }
01052     }
01053 
01054     break;
01055 
01056 
01057   case SYMM_DIAG:
01058 
01059     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01060       for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
01061         temp[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[j][j];
01062         if (i!=j)
01063           temp[j][i] = a[i][j]*b[i][i];
01064       }
01065     }
01066 
01067     break;
01068 
01069 
01070   case SYMM_SYMM:
01071 
01072     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01073       for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
01074         temp[i][j]=temp[j][i]=0.0;
01075         for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
01076           if (i<=m && m<=j) {
01077             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[m][j];
01078             if (i!=j)
01079               temp[j][i] += b[i][m] * a[m][j];
01080           } else if (i<=m && m > j) {
01081             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[j][m];
01082             if (i!=j)
01083               temp[j][i] += b[i][m] * a[j][m];
01084           } else if (i>m && m <= j) {
01085             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[m][j];
01086             if (i!=j)
01087               temp[j][i] += b[m][i] * a[m][j];
01088           } else {
01089             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[j][m];
01090             if (i!=j)
01091               temp[j][i] += b[m][i] * a[j][m];
01092           }
01093         }
01094       }
01095     }
01096 
01097     break;
01098 
01099     
01100   default:
01101 
01102     exit(-12);
01103 
01104   }
01105   
01106   if (a == c || b == c) {
01107     mat_equal(temp,c);
01108     my_free_matrix(temp,1,ar,1,br);
01109   }
01110 
01111   return TRUE;
01112   
01113 }

01115 /*!*****************************************************************************
01116  *******************************************************************************
01117  \note  mat_mult_normal_transpose_size
01118  \date  July 05, 2002
01119  
01120  \remarks 
01121  
01122  multiplies two arbitrary (compatible) matrices a * b' (i.e. a with the
01123  transpose of b)
01124 
01125  *******************************************************************************
01126  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
01127 
01128  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
01129  \param[in]     ar,ac           : number of rows and columns of a
01130  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
01131  \param[in]     br,bc           : number of rows and columns of b
01132  \param[out]    c                : result of multipliciation
01133 
01134  ******************************************************************************/
01135 int
01136 mat_mult_normal_transpose_size(Matrix a, int ar, int ac, Matrix b, int br, int bc,
01137                                Matrix c)
01138 {
01139   int      i,j,m;
01140   Matrix   temp;
01141   int      type;
01142 
01143   if (ac != bc) {
01144     printf("Incompatile matrices in >mat_mult_normal_transpose<\n");
01145     return FALSE;
01146   }
01147 
01148   /* check whether input and output matrices are different */
01149   if (a == c || b == c) {
01150     temp = my_matrix(1,ar,1,br);
01151   } else {
01152     temp = c;
01153   }
01154 
01155   for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01156     for (j=1; j <= br; ++j){
01157       temp[i][j]=0;
01158       for (m=1; m <= bc; ++m){
01159         temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[j][m];
01160       }
01161     }
01162   }
01163   
01164   if (a == c || b == c) {
01165     mat_equal(temp,c);
01166     my_free_matrix(temp,1,ar,1,br);
01167   }
01168 
01169   return TRUE;
01170   
01171 }

01173 /*!*****************************************************************************
01174  *******************************************************************************
01175  \note  mat_mult_transpose_normal
01176  \date  July 6, 2002
01177  
01178  \remarks 
01179  
01180  multiplies transpose of a matrix 'a' with the other matrix 'b' (a'*b)
01181 
01182  *******************************************************************************
01183  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
01184 
01185  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
01186  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
01187  \param[out]    c                : result of multipliciation
01188 
01189  ******************************************************************************/
01190 int
01191 mat_mult_transpose_normal(Matrix a, Matrix b, Matrix c)
01192 {
01193   int      i,j,m;
01194   Matrix   temp;
01195   int      ar,ac,br,bc;
01196   int      type;
01197 
01198   ar = a[0][NR];
01199   ac = a[0][NC];
01200 
01201   br = b[0][NR];
01202   bc = b[0][NC];
01203 
01204   if (ar != br) {
01205     printf("Incompatile matrices in >mat_mult_transpose_normal<\n");
01206     return FALSE;
01207   }
01208 
01209   if ((c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_SYMM) && 
01210       !(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG && b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG)) {
01211     printf("Incompatile matrices in >mat_mult_transpose_normal<: need full matric for c\n");
01212     return FALSE;
01213   }
01214   
01215   /* check whether input and output matrices are different */
01216   
01217   if (a == c || b == c) {
01218     if (c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG) {
01219       temp = my_matrix_diag(1,ac,1,bc);
01220     } else {
01221       temp = my_matrix(1,ac,1,bc);
01222     }
01223   } else {
01224     temp = c;
01225   }
01226 
01227   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE]*10+b[0][MAT_TYPE];
01228 
01229   switch (type) {
01230 
01231   case FULL_FULL:
01232   
01233     for (i=1; i <= ac; ++i) {
01234       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
01235         temp[i][j]=0;
01236         for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
01237           temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[m][j];
01238         }
01239       }
01240     }
01241 
01242     break;
01243 
01244   case FULL_DIAG:
01245 
01246     for (i=1; i <= ac; ++i) {
01247       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
01248         temp[i][j] = a[j][i]*b[j][j];
01249       }
01250     }
01251 
01252     break;
01253 
01254 
01255   case FULL_SYMM:
01256 
01257     for (i=1; i <= ac; ++i) {
01258       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
01259         temp[i][j]=0;
01260         for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
01261           if (m <= j) {
01262             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[m][j];
01263           } else {
01264             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[j][m];
01265           }
01266         }
01267       }
01268     }
01269 
01270     break;
01271 
01272 
01273   case DIAG_FULL:
01274 
01275     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01276       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
01277         temp[i][j] = a[i][i]*b[i][j];
01278       }
01279     }
01280 
01281     break;
01282 
01283 
01284   case DIAG_DIAG:
01285 
01286     if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG) {
01287       for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01288         temp[i][i] = a[i][i]*b[i][i];
01289       }
01290     } else {
01291       for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01292         for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
01293           if (i == j) {
01294             temp[i][i] = a[i][i]*b[i][i];
01295           } else {
01296             temp[i][j] = 0.0;
01297             if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
01298               temp[j][i] = 0.0;
01299           }
01300         }
01301       }
01302     }
01303 
01304     break;
01305 
01306 
01307   case DIAG_SYMM:
01308 
01309     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01310       for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
01311         temp[i][j] = a[i][i]*b[i][j];
01312         if (i!=j)
01313           temp[j][i] = a[j][j]*b[i][j];
01314       }
01315     }
01316 
01317     break;
01318 
01319 
01320   case SYMM_FULL:
01321 
01322     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01323       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
01324         temp[i][j]=0;
01325         for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
01326           if (i<=m) {
01327             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[m][j];
01328           } else {
01329             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[m][j];
01330           }
01331         }
01332       }
01333     }
01334 
01335     break;
01336 
01337 
01338   case SYMM_DIAG:
01339 
01340     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01341       for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){

01343         if (i!=j)
01344           temp[j][i] = a[i][j]*b[i][i];
01345       }
01346     }
01347 
01348     break;
01349 
01350 
01351   case SYMM_SYMM:
01352

01354       for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
01355         temp[i][j]=temp[j][i]=0.0;
01356         for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
01357           if (i<=m && m<=j) {
01358             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[m][j];
01359             if (i!=j)
01360               temp[j][i] += b[i][m] * a[m][j];
01361           } else if (i<=m && m > j) {
01362             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[j][m];
01363             if (i!=j)
01364               temp[j][i] += b[i][m] * a[j][m];
01365           } else if (i>m && m <= j) {
01366             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[m][j];
01367             if (i!=j)
01368               temp[j][i] += b[m][i] * a[m][j];
01369           } else {
01370             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[j][m];
01371             if (i!=j)
01372               temp[j][i] += b[m][i] * a[j][m];
01373           }
01374         }
01375       }
01376     }
01377 
01378     break;
01379 
01380     
01381   default:
01382 
01383     exit(-12);
01384 
01385   }
01386   
01387   if (a == c || b == c) {
01388     mat_equal(temp,c);
01389     my_free_matrix(temp,1,ac,1,bc);
01390   }
01391 
01392   return TRUE;
01393   
01394 }

01396 /*!*****************************************************************************
01397  *******************************************************************************
01398  \note  mat_mult_transpose_normal_size
01399  \date  July 6, 2002
01400  
01401  \remarks 
01402  
01403  multiplies transpose of a matrix 'a' with the other matrix 'b' (a'*b)
01404 
01405  *******************************************************************************
01406  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
01407 
01408  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
01409  \param[in]     ar,ac           : number of rows and columns of a
01410  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
01411  \param[in]     br,bc           : number of rows and columns of b
01412  \param[out]    c                : result of multipliciation
01413 
01414  ******************************************************************************/
01415 int
01416 mat_mult_transpose_normal_size(Matrix a, int ar, int ac, 
01417                                Matrix b, int br, int bc,
01418                                Matrix c)
01419 {
01420   int      i,j,m;
01421   Matrix   temp;
01422 
01423   if (ar != br) {
01424     printf("Incompatile matrices in >mat_mult_transpose_normal_size<\n");
01425     return FALSE;
01426   }
01427 
01428   /* check whether input and output matrices are different */
01429   
01430   if (a == c || b == c) {
01431     temp = my_matrix(1,ac,1,bc);
01432   } else {
01433     temp = c;
01434   }
01435 
01436 
01437   for (i=1; i <= ac; ++i) {
01438     for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
01439       temp[i][j]=0;
01440       for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
01441         temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[m][j];
01442       }
01443     }
01444   }
01445 
01446   if (a == c || b == c) {
01447     mat_equal(temp,c);
01448     my_free_matrix(temp,1,ac,1,bc);
01449   }
01450 
01451   return TRUE;
01452   
01453 }

01455 /*!*****************************************************************************
01456  *******************************************************************************
01457  \note  mat_mult_transpose_transpose
01458  \date  July 06, 2002
01459  
01460  \remarks 
01461  
01462  multiplies the transpose of two arbitrary matrices a and b (a'*b')
01463 
01464  *******************************************************************************
01465  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
01466 
01467  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
01468  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
01469  \param[out]    c                : result of multipliciation
01470 
01471  ******************************************************************************/
01472 int
01473 mat_mult_transpose_transpose(Matrix a, Matrix b, Matrix c)
01474 {
01475   int      i,j,m;
01476   Matrix   temp;
01477   int      ar,ac,br,bc;
01478   int      type;
01479 
01480   ar = a[0][NR];
01481   ac = a[0][NC];
01482 
01483   br = b[0][NR];
01484   bc = b[0][NC];
01485 
01486   if (ar != bc) {
01487     printf("Incompatile matrices in >mat_mult_transpose_transpose<\n");
01488     return FALSE;
01489   }
01490 
01491   if ((c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_SYMM) && 
01492       !(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG && b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG)) {
01493     printf("Incompatile matrices in >mat_mult_transpose_transpose<: need full matric for c\n");
01494     return FALSE;
01495   }
01496   
01497   /* check whether input and output matrices are different */
01498   
01499   if (a == c || b == c) {
01500     if (c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG) {
01501       temp = my_matrix_diag(1,ac,1,br);
01502     } else {
01503       temp = my_matrix(1,ac,1,br);
01504     }
01505   } else {
01506     temp = c;
01507   }
01508 
01509   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE]*10+b[0][MAT_TYPE];
01510 
01511   switch (type) {
01512 
01513   case FULL_FULL:
01514   
01515     for (i=1; i <= ac; ++i) {
01516       for (j=1; j <= br; ++j){
01517         temp[i][j]=0;
01518         for (m=1; m <= bc; ++m){
01519           temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[j][m];
01520         }
01521       }
01522     }
01523 
01524     break;
01525 
01526   case FULL_DIAG:
01527 
01528     for (i=1; i <= ac; ++i) {
01529       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
01530         temp[i][j] = a[j][i]*b[j][j];
01531       }
01532     }
01533 
01534     break;
01535 
01536 
01537   case FULL_SYMM:
01538 
01539     for (i=1; i <= ac; ++i) {
01540       for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
01541         temp[i][j]=0;
01542         for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
01543           if (m <= j) {
01544             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[m][j];
01545           } else {
01546             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[j][m];
01547           }
01548         }
01549       }
01550     }
01551 
01552     break;
01553 
01554 
01555   case DIAG_FULL:
01556 
01557     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01558       for (j=1; j <= br; ++j){
01559         temp[i][j] = a[i][i]*b[j][i];
01560       }
01561     }
01562 
01563     break;
01564 
01565 
01566   case DIAG_DIAG:
01567 
01568     if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG) {
01569       for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01570         temp[i][i] = a[i][i]*b[i][i];
01571       }
01572     } else {
01573       for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01574         for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
01575           if (i == j) {
01576             temp[i][i] = a[i][i]*b[i][i];
01577           } else {
01578             temp[i][j] = 0.0;
01579             if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
01580               temp[j][i] = 0.0;
01581           }
01582         }
01583       }
01584     }
01585 
01586     break;
01587 
01588 
01589   case DIAG_SYMM:
01590 
01591     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01592       for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
01593         temp[i][j] = a[i][i]*b[i][j];
01594         if (i!=j)
01595           temp[j][i] = a[j][j]*b[i][j];
01596       }
01597     }
01598 
01599     break;
01600 
01601 
01602   case SYMM_FULL:
01603 
01604     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01605       for (j=1; j <= br; ++j){
01606         temp[i][j]=0;
01607         for (m=1; m <= bc; ++m){
01608           if (i<=m) {
01609             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[j][m];
01610           } else {
01611             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[j][m];
01612           }
01613         }
01614       }
01615     }
01616 
01617     break;
01618 
01619 
01620   case SYMM_DIAG:
01621 
01622     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01623       for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
01624         temp[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[j][j];
01625         if (i!=j)
01626           temp[j][i] = a[i][j]*b[i][i];
01627       }
01628     }
01629 
01630     break;
01631 
01632 
01633   case SYMM_SYMM:
01634 
01635     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
01636       for (j=i; j <= bc; ++j){
01637         temp[i][j]=temp[j][i]=0.0;
01638         for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
01639           if (i<=m && m<=j) {
01640             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[m][j];
01641             if (i!=j)
01642               temp[j][i] += b[i][m] * a[m][j];
01643           } else if (i<=m && m > j) {
01644             temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[j][m];
01645             if (i!=j)
01646               temp[j][i] += b[i][m] * a[j][m];
01647           } else if (i>m && m <= j) {
01648             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[m][j];
01649             if (i!=j)
01650               temp[j][i] += b[m][i] * a[m][j];
01651           } else {
01652             temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[j][m];
01653             if (i!=j)
01654               temp[j][i] += b[m][i] * a[j][m];
01655           }
01656         }
01657       }
01658     }
01659 
01660     break;
01661 
01662     
01663   default:
01664 
01665     exit(-12);
01666 
01667   }
01668   
01669   if (a == c || b == c) {
01670     mat_equal(temp,c);
01671     my_free_matrix(temp,1,ac,1,br);
01672   }
01673 
01674   return TRUE;
01675   
01676 }
01677 
01678 /*!*****************************************************************************
01679  *******************************************************************************
01680  \note  mat_mult_transpose_transpose_size
01681  \date  July 06, 2002
01682  
01683  \remarks 
01684  
01685  multiplies the transpose of two arbitrary matrices a and b (a'*b')
01686 
01687  *******************************************************************************
01688  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
01689 
01690  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
01691  \param[in]     ar,ac           : number of rows and columns for a
01692  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
01693  \param[in]     br,bc           : number of rows and columns for b
01694  \param[out]    c                : result of multipliciation
01695 
01696  ******************************************************************************/
01697 int
01698 mat_mult_transpose_transpose_size(Matrix a, int ar, int ac, Matrix b, int br, int bc, Matrix c)
01699 {
01700   int      i,j,m;
01701   Matrix   temp;
01702   int      type;
01703 
01704   if (ar != bc) {
01705     printf("Incompatile matrices in >mat_mult_transpose_transpose<\n");
01706     return FALSE;
01707   }
01708 
01709   
01710   /* check whether input and output matrices are different */
01711   if (a == c || b == c) {
01712     temp = my_matrix(1,ac,1,br);
01713   } else {
01714     temp = c;
01715   }
01716   
01717   for (i=1; i <= ac; ++i) {
01718     for (j=1; j <= br; ++j){
01719       temp[i][j]=0;
01720       for (m=1; m <= bc; ++m){
01721         temp[i][j] += a[m][i] * b[j][m];
01722       }
01723     }
01724   }
01725   
01726   if (a == c || b == c) {
01727     mat_equal(temp,c);
01728     my_free_matrix(temp,1,ac,1,br);
01729   }
01730 
01731   return TRUE;
01732   
01733 }
01734 
01735 /*!*****************************************************************************
01736  *******************************************************************************
01737  \note  mat_mult_normal_normal
01738  \date  July 06, 2002
01739  
01740  \remarks 
01741  
01742  multiplies two arbitrary matrices a and b. This method is only provided for
01743  naming consistency and simply calls mat_mult() internally.
01744 
01745  *******************************************************************************
01746  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
01747 
01748  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
01749  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
01750  \param[out]    c                : result of multipliciation
01751 
01752  ******************************************************************************/
01753 int
01754 mat_mult_normal_normal(Matrix a, Matrix b, Matrix c){
01755   return mat_mult(a,b,c);
01756 }
01757 
01758 /*!*****************************************************************************
01759  *******************************************************************************
01760  \note  mat_dmult_normal_normal
01761  \date  July 08, 2002
01762  
01763  \remarks 
01764  
01765  Multiplies two matrices a and b elementwise. Matrices must be of the same
01766  size. Implements the equivalent of the .* operator in Matlab
01767 
01768  *******************************************************************************
01769  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
01770 
01771  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
01772  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
01773  \param[out]    c                : destination matrix c
01774 
01775  ******************************************************************************/
01776 int
01777 mat_dmult_normal_normal(Matrix a, Matrix b, Matrix c){
01778   int i,j;
01779   int ar,ac,br,bc;
01780   int type;
01781 
01782   ar = a[0][NR];
01783   ac = a[0][NC];
01784   br = b[0][NR];
01785   bc = b[0][NC];
01786 
01787   /* Check for equal input matrix sizes */
01788   if(ar!=br || ac!=bc){
01789     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible input matrices in >mat_dot_mult<\n");
01790     return FALSE;
01791   }
01792   /* Check for equal output matrix size */
01793   if(c[0][NR]!=ar || c[0][NC]!=ac){
01794     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix size in >mat_dot_mult<\n");
01795     return FALSE;
01796   }
01797   /* Check if we're allowed to have a diagonal output matrix */
01798   if((c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG) &&
01799      !(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG)){
01800     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix in >mat_dot_mult<\n");
01801     return FALSE;
01802   }
01803   /* Check if we're allowed to have a symmetric output matrix */
01804   if((c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_SYMM) &&
01805      (a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL) &&
01806      !(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG)){
01807     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix in >mat_dot_mult<\n");
01808     return FALSE;
01809   }
01810 
01811   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE]*10+b[0][MAT_TYPE];
01812 
01813   switch(type){
01814   case FULL_FULL:
01815     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01816       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++)
01817         c[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[i][j];
01818     break;
01819 
01820   case FULL_SYMM:
01821     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01822       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++){
01823         c[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[i][j];
01824         c[j][i] = a[j][i]*b[i][j];
01825       }
01826     break;
01827 
01828   case SYMM_FULL:
01829     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01830       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++){
01831         c[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[i][j];
01832         c[j][i] = a[i][j]*b[j][i];
01833       }
01834     break;
01835 
01836   case SYMM_SYMM:
01837     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01838       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++)
01839         c[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[i][j];
01840     if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
01841       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01842         for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
01843           c[j][i] = c[i][j];
01844     break;
01845 
01846   case FULL_DIAG:
01847   case SYMM_DIAG:
01848   case DIAG_FULL:
01849   case DIAG_SYMM:
01850   case DIAG_DIAG:
01851     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01852       c[i][i] = a[i][i]*b[i][i];
01853     break;
01854   default:
01855     fprintf(stderr,"Unrecognized matrix type in >mat_dot_mult<");
01856     exit(-12);
01857   }
01858 
01859   /* 
01860    * If one of the input matrices was diagonal then zero the remainder
01861    * of the output matrix
01862    */
01863   if(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG){
01864     if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]<=IS_SYMM)
01865       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01866         for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
01867           c[i][j] = 0.0;
01868     if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
01869       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01870         for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
01871           c[j][i] = 0.0;
01872   }
01873   return TRUE;
01874 }
01875 
01876 /*!*****************************************************************************
01877  *******************************************************************************
01878  \note  mat_dmult_normal_transpose
01879  \date  July 08, 2002
01880  
01881  \remarks 
01882  
01883  Multiplies (elementwise) matrix a with the transpose of matrix
01884  b. Implements the equivalent of the .* operator in Matlab
01885 
01886  *******************************************************************************
01887  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
01888 
01889  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
01890  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
01891  \param[out]    c                : destination matrix c
01892 
01893  ******************************************************************************/
01894 int
01895 mat_dmult_normal_transpose(Matrix a, Matrix b, Matrix c){
01896   int i,j;
01897   int ar,ac,br,bc;
01898   int type;
01899 
01900   ar = a[0][NR];
01901   ac = a[0][NC];
01902   br = b[0][NR];
01903   bc = b[0][NC];
01904 
01905   /* Check for equal input matrix sizes */
01906   if(ar!=bc || ac!=br){
01907     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible input matrices in >mat_dmult_normal_transpose<\n");
01908     return FALSE;
01909   }
01910   /* Check for equal output matrix size */
01911   if(c[0][NR]!=ar || c[0][NC]!=ac){
01912     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix size in >mat_dmult_normal_transpose<\n");
01913     return FALSE;
01914   }
01915   /* Check if we're allowed to have a diagonal output matrix */
01916   if((c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG) &&
01917      !(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG)){
01918     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix in >mat_dmult_normal_transpose<\n");
01919     return FALSE;
01920   }
01921   /* Check if we're allowed to have a symmetric output matrix */
01922   if((c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_SYMM) &&
01923      (a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL) &&
01924      !(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG)){
01925     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix in >mat_dmult_normal_transpose<\n");
01926     return FALSE;
01927   }
01928 
01929   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE]*10+b[0][MAT_TYPE];
01930 
01931   switch(type){
01932   case FULL_FULL:
01933     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01934       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++)
01935         c[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[j][i];
01936     break;
01937 
01938   case FULL_SYMM:
01939     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01940       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++){
01941         c[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[i][j];
01942         c[j][i] = a[j][i]*b[i][j];
01943       }
01944     break;
01945 
01946   case SYMM_FULL:
01947     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01948       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++){
01949         c[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[j][i];
01950         c[j][i] = a[i][j]*b[i][j];
01951       }
01952     break;
01953 
01954   case SYMM_SYMM:
01955     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01956       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++)
01957         c[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[i][j];
01958     if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
01959       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01960         for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
01961           c[j][i] = c[i][j];
01962     break;
01963 
01964   case FULL_DIAG:
01965   case SYMM_DIAG:
01966   case DIAG_FULL:
01967   case DIAG_SYMM:
01968   case DIAG_DIAG:
01969     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01970       c[i][i] = a[i][i]*b[i][i];
01971     break;
01972   default:
01973     fprintf(stderr,"Unrecognized matrix type in >mat_dmult_normal_transpose<");
01974     exit(-12);
01975   }
01976 
01977   /* 
01978    * If one of the input matrices was diagonal then zero the remainder
01979    * of the output matrix
01980    */
01981   if(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG){
01982     if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]<=IS_SYMM)
01983       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01984         for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
01985           c[i][j] = 0.0;
01986     if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
01987       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
01988         for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
01989           c[j][i] = 0.0;
01990   }
01991   return TRUE;
01992 }
01993 
01994 /*!*****************************************************************************
01995  *******************************************************************************
01996  \note  mat_dmult_transpose_normal
01997  \date  July 08, 2002
01998  
01999  \remarks 
02000  
02001  Multiplies (elementwise) transpose of matrix a with matrix
02002  b. Implements the equivalent of the .* operator in Matlab
02003  
02004  *******************************************************************************
02005  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
02006 
02007  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
02008  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
02009  \param[out]    c                : destination matrix c
02010 
02011  ******************************************************************************/
02012 int
02013 mat_dmult_transpose_normal(Matrix a, Matrix b, Matrix c){
02014   int i,j;
02015   int ar,ac,br,bc;
02016   int type;
02017 
02018   ar = a[0][NR];
02019   ac = a[0][NC];
02020   br = b[0][NR];
02021   bc = b[0][NC];
02022 
02023   /* Check for equal input matrix sizes */
02024   if(ac!=br || ar!=bc){
02025     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible input matrices in >mat_dmult_transpose_normal<\n");
02026     return FALSE;
02027   }
02028   /* Check for equal output matrix size */
02029   if(c[0][NR]!=ac || c[0][NC]!=ar){
02030     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix size in >mat_dmult_transpose_normal<\n");
02031     return FALSE;
02032   }
02033   /* Check if we're allowed to have a diagonal output matrix */
02034   if((c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG) &&
02035      !(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG)){
02036     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix in >mat_dmult_transpose_normal<\n");
02037     return FALSE;
02038   }
02039   /* Check if we're allowed to have a symmetric output matrix */
02040   if((c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_SYMM) &&
02041      (a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL) &&
02042      !(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG)){
02043     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix in >mat_dmult_transpose_normal<\n");
02044     return FALSE;
02045   }
02046 
02047   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE]*10+b[0][MAT_TYPE];
02048 
02049   switch(type){
02050   case FULL_FULL:
02051     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02052       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++)
02053         c[i][j] = a[j][i]*b[i][j];
02054     break;
02055 
02056   case FULL_SYMM:
02057     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02058       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++){
02059         c[i][j] = a[j][i]*b[i][j];
02060         c[j][i] = a[i][j]*b[i][j];
02061       }
02062     break;
02063 
02064   case SYMM_FULL:
02065     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02066       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++){
02067         c[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[i][j];
02068         c[j][i] = a[i][j]*b[j][i];
02069       }
02070     break;
02071 
02072   case SYMM_SYMM:
02073     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02074       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++)
02075         c[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[i][j];
02076     if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
02077       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02078         for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
02079           c[j][i] = c[i][j];
02080     break;
02081 
02082   case FULL_DIAG:
02083   case SYMM_DIAG:
02084   case DIAG_FULL:
02085   case DIAG_SYMM:
02086   case DIAG_DIAG:
02087     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02088       c[i][i] = a[i][i]*b[i][i];
02089     break;
02090   default:
02091     fprintf(stderr,"Unrecognized matrix type in >mat_dmult_transpose_normal<");
02092     exit(-12);
02093   }
02094 
02095   /* 
02096    * If one of the input matrices was diagonal then zero the remainder
02097    * of the output matrix
02098    */
02099   if(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG){
02100     if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]<=IS_SYMM)
02101       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02102         for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
02103           c[i][j] = 0.0;
02104     if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
02105       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02106         for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
02107           c[j][i] = 0.0;
02108   }
02109   return TRUE;
02110 }
02111 
02112 /*!*****************************************************************************
02113  *******************************************************************************
02114  \note  mat_dmult_transpose_transpose
02115  \date  July 08, 2002
02116  
02117  \remarks 
02118  
02119  Multiplies transposes of matrices a and b elementwise. Matrices must
02120  be of the same size. Implements the equivalent of the .* operator in
02121  Matlab
02122 
02123  *******************************************************************************
02124  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
02125 
02126  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
02127  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
02128  \param[out]    c                : destination matrix c
02129 
02130  ******************************************************************************/
02131 int
02132 mat_dmult_transpose_transpose(Matrix a, Matrix b, Matrix c){
02133   int i,j;
02134   int ar,ac,br,bc;
02135   int type;
02136 
02137   ar = a[0][NR];
02138   ac = a[0][NC];
02139   br = b[0][NR];
02140   bc = b[0][NC];
02141 
02142   /* Check for equal input matrix sizes */
02143   if(ar!=br || ac!=bc){
02144     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible input matrices in >mat_dmult_transpose_transpose<\n");
02145     return FALSE;
02146   }
02147   /* Check for equal output matrix size */
02148   if(c[0][NR]!=ac || c[0][NC]!=ar){
02149     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix size in >mat_dmult_transpose_transpose<\n");
02150     return FALSE;
02151   }
02152   /* Check if we're allowed to have a diagonal output matrix */
02153   if((c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG) &&
02154      !(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG)){
02155     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix in >mat_dmult_transpose_transpose<\n");
02156     return FALSE;
02157   }
02158   /* Check if we're allowed to have a symmetric output matrix */
02159   if((c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_SYMM) &&
02160      (a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL) &&
02161      !(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG)){
02162     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix in >mat_dmult_transpose_transpose<\n");
02163     return FALSE;
02164   }
02165 
02166   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE]*10+b[0][MAT_TYPE];
02167 
02168   switch(type){
02169   case FULL_FULL:
02170     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02171       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++)
02172         c[i][j] = a[j][i]*b[j][i];
02173     break;
02174 
02175   case FULL_SYMM:
02176     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02177       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++){
02178         c[i][j] = a[j][i]*b[i][j];
02179         c[j][i] = a[i][j]*b[i][j];
02180       }
02181     break;
02182 
02183   case SYMM_FULL:
02184     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02185       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++){
02186         c[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[j][i];
02187         c[j][i] = a[i][j]*b[i][j];
02188       }
02189     break;
02190 
02191   case SYMM_SYMM:
02192     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02193       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++)
02194         c[i][j] = a[i][j]*b[i][j];
02195     if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
02196       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02197         for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
02198           c[j][i] = c[i][j];
02199     break;
02200 
02201   case FULL_DIAG:
02202   case SYMM_DIAG:
02203   case DIAG_FULL:
02204   case DIAG_SYMM:
02205   case DIAG_DIAG:
02206     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02207       c[i][i] = a[i][i]*b[i][i];
02208     break;
02209   default:
02210     fprintf(stderr,"Unrecognized matrix type in >mat_dmult_transpose_transpose<");
02211     exit(-12);
02212   }
02213 
02214   /* 
02215    * If one of the input matrices was diagonal then zero the remainder
02216    * of the output matrix
02217    */
02218   if(a[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG || b[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG){
02219     if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]<=IS_SYMM)
02220       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02221         for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
02222           c[i][j] = 0.0;
02223     if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
02224       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
02225         for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
02226           c[j][i] = 0.0;
02227   }
02228   return TRUE;
02229 }
02230 
02231 /*!*****************************************************************************
02232  *******************************************************************************
02233  \note  mat_dmult
02234  \date  July 08, 2002
02235  
02236  \remarks 
02237  
02238  Wrapper method for mat_dmult_normal_normal()
02239 
02240  *******************************************************************************
02241  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
02242 
02243  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
02244  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
02245  \param[out]    c                : destination matrix c
02246 
02247  ******************************************************************************/
02248 int
02249 mat_dmult(Matrix a, Matrix b, Matrix c){
02250   return mat_dmult_normal_normal(a,b,c);
02251 }
02252 
02253 /*!*****************************************************************************
02254  *******************************************************************************
02255  \note  mat_mult_size
02256  \date  August 17, 92
02257  
02258  \remarks 
02259  
02260  multiplies two arbitrary (compatible) matrices a * b
02261 
02262  *******************************************************************************
02263  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
02264 
02265  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
02266  \param[in]     ar              : number of rows of a
02267  \param[in]     ac              : number of columns of a
02268  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
02269  \param[in]     br              : number of rows of b
02270  \param[in]     bc              : number of columns of b
02271  \param[out]    c                : result of multipliciation
02272 
02273  ******************************************************************************/
02274 int
02275 mat_mult_size(Matrix a, int ar, int ac, Matrix b, int br, int bc, Matrix c)
02276 {
02277   int      i,j,m;
02278   Matrix   temp;
02279 
02280   if (ac != br) {
02281     printf("Incompatile matrices in >mat_mult<\n");
02282     return FALSE;
02283   }
02284 
02285   /* check whether input and output matrices are different */
02286   
02287   if (a == c || b == c) {
02288     temp = my_matrix(1,ar,1,bc);
02289   } else {
02290     temp = c;
02291   }
02292 
02293   for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
02294     for (j=1; j <= bc; ++j){
02295       temp[i][j]=0;
02296       for (m=1; m <= br; ++m){
02297         temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * b[m][j];
02298       }
02299     }
02300   }
02301   
02302   if (a == c || b == c) {
02303     mat_equal_size(temp,ar,bc,c);
02304     my_free_matrix(temp,1,ar,1,bc);
02305   }
02306 
02307   return TRUE;
02308   
02309 }
02310 
02311 /*!*****************************************************************************
02312  *******************************************************************************
02313  \note  mat_vec_mult
02314  \date  August 17, 92
02315  
02316  \remarks 
02317  
02318  multiplies a matrix with a vector: a * b, assuming indices
02319  start at "1".
02320  Note: The program can also cope with passing the same vector as
02321  factor and result.
02322  
02323  *******************************************************************************
02324  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
02325  
02326  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
02327  \param[in]     b                : vector b
02328  \param[out]    c                : result of multipliciation
02329  
02330  ******************************************************************************/
02331 int
02332 mat_vec_mult(Matrix a, Vector b, Vector c)
02333 {
02334   int     i,j,m;
02335   Vector  temp;
02336   int     ac,ar,br,cr;
02337 
02338   ac = a[0][NC];
02339   ar = a[0][NR];
02340   br = b[NR];
02341   cr = c[NR];
02342 
02343   if (ac != br) {
02344     printf("Matrix and vector are incompatible.\n");
02345     return FALSE;
02346   }
02347 
02348   /* bugfix (adsouza July 10, 2002)
02349   if (cr != br) {
02350     printf("Input and output vector are incompatible.\n");
02351     return FALSE;
02352   }
02353   end of old version */
02354 
02355   if (cr != ar) {
02356     printf("Input and output vector are incompatible.\n");
02357     return FALSE;
02358   }
02359 
02360 
02361   if (b == c) {
02362     temp = my_vector(1,ar);
02363   } else {
02364     temp = c;
02365   }
02366 
02367   switch ((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
02368 
02369   case IS_FULL:
02370 
02371     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
02372       temp[i]=0;
02373       for (j=1; j <= br; ++j){
02374         temp[i] += a[i][j] * b[j];
02375       }
02376     }
02377 
02378     break;
02379 
02380 
02381   case IS_DIAG:
02382 
02383     for (j=1; j <= br; ++j){
02384       temp[j] = a[j][j] * b[j];
02385     }
02386 
02387     break;
02388 
02389 
02390   case IS_SYMM:
02391 
02392     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i)
02393       temp[i]=0;
02394 
02395     for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
02396       for (j=i; j <= br; ++j){
02397         temp[i] += a[i][j] * b[j];
02398         if (i!=j)
02399           temp[j] += a[i][j] * b[i];
02400       }
02401     }
02402 
02403     break;
02404 
02405 
02406   default:
02407     
02408     exit(-12);
02409 
02410   }
02411 
02412   if (b == c) {
02413     vec_equal(temp,c);
02414     my_free_vector(temp,1,ar);
02415   }
02416 
02417   return TRUE;
02418 
02419 }
02420 
02421 /*!*****************************************************************************
02422  *******************************************************************************
02423  \note  mat_vec_mult_size
02424  \date  August 17, 92
02425  
02426  \remarks 
02427  
02428  multiplies a matrix with a vector: a * b, assuming indices
02429  start at "1".
02430  Note: The program can also cope with passing the same vector as
02431  factor and result.
02432  
02433  *******************************************************************************
02434  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
02435  
02436  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
02437  \param[in]     ar              : number of rows of a
02438  \param[in]     ac              : number of columns of a
02439  \param[in]     b                : vector b
02440  \param[in]     br              : number of rows of b
02441  \param[out]    c                : result of multipliciation
02442  
02443  ******************************************************************************/
02444 int
02445 mat_vec_mult_size(Matrix a, int ar, int ac, Vector b, int br, Vector c)
02446 {
02447   int     i,j,m;
02448   Vector  temp;
02449   int     cr;
02450 
02451   cr = br;
02452 
02453   if (ac != br) {
02454     printf("Matrix and vector are incompatible in mat_vec_mult_size.\n");
02455     return FALSE;
02456   }
02457 
02458   if (cr != br) {
02459     printf("Input and output vector are incompatible in mat_vec_mult_size.\n");
02460     return FALSE;
02461   }
02462 
02463   if (b == c) {
02464     temp = my_vector(1,ar);
02465   } else {
02466     temp = c;
02467   }
02468 
02469 
02470   for (i=1; i <= ar; ++i) {
02471     temp[i]=0;
02472     for (j=1; j <= br; ++j){
02473       temp[i] += a[i][j] * b[j];
02474     }
02475   }
02476 
02477   if (b == c) {
02478     vec_equal_size(temp,ar,c);
02479     my_free_vector(temp,1,ar);
02480   }
02481 
02482   return TRUE;
02483 
02484 }

02562 /*!*****************************************************************************
02563  *******************************************************************************
02564  \note  mat_zero
02565  \date  August 17, 92
02566  
02567  \remarks 
02568  
02569  zeros a matrix
02570  
02571  *******************************************************************************
02572  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
02573  
02574  \param[in]     a                : vector a
02575  
02576  ******************************************************************************/
02577 void     
02578 mat_zero(Matrix a)
02579      
02580 {
02581   int i,j;
02582 
02583   switch ((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
02584   case IS_FULL:
02585     for (i=1; i<=a[0][NR]; ++i)
02586       for (j=1; j<=a[0][NC]; ++j)
02587         a[i][j] = 0.0;
02588 
02589     break;
02590 
02591   case IS_DIAG:
02592     for (i=1; i<=a[0][NR]; ++i)
02593       a[i][i] = 0.0;
02594 
02595     break;
02596 
02597   case IS_SYMM:
02598     for (i=1; i<=a[0][NR]; ++i)
02599       for (j=i; j<=a[0][NC]; ++j)
02600         a[i][j] = 0.0;
02601 
02602     break;
02603 
02604   default:
02605     exit(-14);
02606   }
02607 }
02608

02733 /*!*****************************************************************************
02734  *******************************************************************************
02735  \note  mat_eye
02736  \date  August 17, 92
02737  
02738  \remarks 
02739  
02740  makes a matrix the identity matrix
02741  
02742  *******************************************************************************
02743  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
02744  
02745  \param[in]     a                : vector a
02746  
02747  ******************************************************************************/
02748 void     
02749 mat_eye(Matrix a)
02750      
02751 {
02752   int i,j;
02753 
02754   switch ((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
02755 
02756   case IS_FULL:
02757 
02758     for (i=1; i<=a[0][NR]; ++i) {
02759       for (j=1; j<=a[0][NC]; ++j) {
02760         if (i==j) {
02761           a[i][j] = 1.0;
02762         } else {
02763           a[i][j] = 0.0;
02764         }
02765       }
02766     }
02767 
02768     break;
02769 
02770 
02771   case IS_DIAG:
02772 
02773     for (i=1; i<=a[0][NR]; ++i) {
02774       a[i][i] = 1.0;
02775     }
02776 
02777     break;
02778 
02779 
02780   case IS_SYMM:
02781 
02782     for (i=1; i<=a[0][NR]; ++i) {
02783       for (j=i; j<=a[0][NC]; ++j) {
02784         if (i==j) {
02785           a[i][j] = 1.0;
02786         } else {
02787           a[i][j] = 0.0;
02788         }
02789       }
02790     }
02791 
02792     break;
02793 
02794 
02795   default:
02796     
02797     exit(-14);
02798 
02799   }
02800 
02801 }

02834 /*!*****************************************************************************
02835  *******************************************************************************
02836  \note  vec_equal
02837  \date  August 17, 92
02838  
02839  \remarks 
02840  
02841  set vector c = a
02842  vector indices start at "1".
02843  
02844  *******************************************************************************
02845  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
02846  
02847  \param[in]     a                : vector a
02848  \param[out]    c                : result of assignment
02849  
02850  ******************************************************************************/
02851 int
02852 vec_equal(Vector a, Vector c)
02853      
02854 {
02855   int i;
02856 
02857   if (a[NR] != c[NR]) {
02858     printf("Incompatible vectors in vec_equal\n");
02859     return FALSE;
02860   }
02861 
02862   for (i=1; i<=a[NR]; ++i) c[i] = a[i];
02863 
02864   return TRUE;
02865 }
02866 
02867 /*!*****************************************************************************
02868  *******************************************************************************
02869  \note  vec_equal_apply_math
02870  \date  August 17, 92
02871  
02872  \remarks 
02873  
02874  set vector c = func(a)
02875  vector indices start at "1".
02876  
02877  *******************************************************************************
02878  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
02879  
02880  \param[in]     a                : vector a
02881  \param[in]     func            : function to be applied
02882  \param[out]    c                : result of assignment
02883  
02884  ******************************************************************************/
02885 int
02886 vec_equal_apply_math(Vector a, double (*func)(double), Vector c)
02887      
02888 {
02889   int i;
02890 
02891   if (a[NR] != c[NR]) {
02892     printf("Incompatible vectors in vec_equal\n");
02893     return FALSE;
02894   }
02895 
02896   for (i=1; i<=a[NR]; ++i) c[i] = (*func)(a[i]);
02897 
02898   return TRUE;
02899 }

02992 /*!*****************************************************************************
02993  *******************************************************************************
02994  \note  vec_sum
02995  \date  July 10, 2002
02996  
02997  \remarks 
02998  
02999  Sums up the elements of a vector
03000 
03001  *******************************************************************************
03002  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03003 
03004  \param[in]     a                : vector a
03005  \param[out]    s                : sum of the elements of a
03006 
03007  ******************************************************************************/
03008 int
03009 vec_sum(Vector a, double* s){
03010   int i;
03011 
03012   (*s) = 0.0;
03013   for(i=1; i<=a[NR]; i++)
03014     (*s) += a[i];
03015 
03016   return TRUE;
03017 }
03018 
03019 /*!*****************************************************************************
03020  *******************************************************************************
03021  \note  vec_sum_weighted
03022  \date  July 18, 2002
03023  
03024  \remarks 
03025  
03026  Computes a weighted sum of the elements of a vector
03027 
03028  *******************************************************************************
03029  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03030 
03031  \param[in]     a                : vector a
03032  \param[in]     w                : weight vector w
03033  \param[out]    s                : sum of the elements of a
03034 
03035  ******************************************************************************/
03036 int
03037 vec_sum_weighted(Vector a, Vector w, double* s){
03038   int i;
03039 
03040   if(a[NR]!=w[NR]){
03041     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incorrect weight vector length in >vec_sum_weighted<\n");
03042     return FALSE;
03043   }
03044 
03045   (*s) = 0.0;
03046   for(i=1; i<=a[NR]; i++)
03047     (*s) += w[i]*a[i];
03048 
03049   return TRUE;
03050 }
03051 
03052 /*!*****************************************************************************
03053  *******************************************************************************
03054  \note  mat_sum_rows
03055  \date  July 17, 2002
03056  
03057  \remarks 
03058  
03059  Sums up the row vectors of a matrix
03060 
03061  *******************************************************************************
03062  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03063 
03064  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
03065  \param[out]    b                : vector containing the summed rows of a
03066 
03067  ******************************************************************************/
03068 int
03069 mat_sum_rows(Matrix a, Vector b){
03070   int i,j;
03071   int ar,ac,br;
03072   int type;
03073 
03074   ar   = a[0][NR];
03075   ac   = a[0][NC];
03076   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE];
03077   br   = b[NR];
03078 
03079   if(ac != br)
03080     fprintf(stderr,"Incorrect length of destination vector in >mat_sum_rows<");
03081 
03082   vec_zero(b);
03083 
03084   switch(type){
03085   case IS_FULL:
03086     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
03087       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++)
03088         b[j] += a[i][j];
03089     break;
03090 
03091   case IS_SYMM:
03092     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++){
03093       for(j=1; j<i; j++)
03094         b[j] += a[j][i];
03095       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++)
03096         b[j] += a[i][j];
03097     }
03098     break;
03099 
03100   case IS_DIAG:
03101     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
03102       b[i] = a[i][i];
03103     break;
03104 
03105   default:
03106     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Unrecognized matrix type in >mat_sum_rows<");
03107     exit(-12);
03108   }
03109 
03110   return TRUE;
03111 }
03112 
03113 /*!*****************************************************************************
03114  *******************************************************************************
03115  \note  mat_sum_rows_weighted
03116  \date  July 18, 2002
03117  
03118  \remarks 
03119  
03120  Computes a weighted sum of the row vectors of a matrix
03121 
03122  *******************************************************************************
03123  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03124 
03125  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
03126  \param[in]     w                : weight vector a
03127  \param[out]    b                : vector containing the summed rows of a
03128 
03129  ******************************************************************************/
03130 int
03131 mat_sum_rows_weighted(Matrix a, Vector w, Vector b){
03132   int i,j;
03133   int ar,ac,wr,br;
03134   int type;
03135 
03136   ar   = a[0][NR];
03137   ac   = a[0][NC];
03138   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE];
03139   wr   = w[NR];
03140   br   = b[NR];
03141 
03142   if(ar != wr){
03143     fprintf(stderr,"ERROR: Incorrect length of weight vector in >mat_sum_rows_weighted<");
03144     return FALSE;
03145   }
03146   if(ac != br){
03147     fprintf(stderr,"ERROR: Incorrect length of destination vector in >mat_sum_rows_weighted<");
03148     return FALSE;
03149   }
03150 
03151   vec_zero(b);
03152 
03153   switch(type){
03154   case IS_FULL:
03155     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
03156       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++)
03157         b[j] += w[i]*a[i][j];
03158     break;
03159 
03160   case IS_SYMM:
03161     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++){
03162       for(j=1; j<i; j++)
03163         b[j] += w[i]*a[j][i];
03164       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++)
03165         b[j] += w[i]*a[i][j];
03166     }
03167     break;
03168 
03169   case IS_DIAG:
03170     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
03171       b[i] = w[i]*a[i][i];
03172     break;
03173 
03174   default:
03175     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Unrecognized matrix type in >mat_sum_rows<");
03176     exit(-12);
03177   }
03178 
03179   return TRUE;
03180 }
03181 
03182 /*!*****************************************************************************

03193 
03194  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
03195  \param[out]    b                : vector containing the summed columns of a
03196 
03197  ******************************************************************************/
03198 int
03199 mat_sum_columns(Matrix a, Vector b){
03200   int i,j;
03201   int ar,ac,br;
03202   int type;
03203 
03204   ar   = a[0][NR];
03205   ac   = a[0][NC];
03206   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE];
03207   br   = b[NR];
03208 
03209   if(ar != br){
03210     fprintf(stderr,"ERROR: Incorrect length of destination vector in >mat_sum_columns<");
03211     return FALSE;
03212   }
03213 
03214   vec_zero(b);
03215 
03216   switch(type){
03217   case IS_FULL:
03218     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
03219       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++)
03220         b[i] += a[i][j];
03221     break;
03222 
03223   case IS_SYMM:
03224     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++){
03225       for(j=1; j<i; j++)
03226         b[i] += a[j][i];
03227       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++)
03228         b[i] += a[i][j];
03229     }
03230     break;
03231 
03232   case IS_DIAG:
03233     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
03234       b[i] = a[i][i];
03235     break;
03236 
03237   default:
03238     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Unrecognized matrix type in >mat_sum_columns<");
03239     exit(-12);
03240   }

03242   return TRUE;
