03245 /*!*****************************************************************************
03246  *******************************************************************************
03247  \note  mat_sum_columns_weighted
03248  \date  July 18, 2002
03249  
03250  \remarks 
03251  
03252  Compute the weighted sum of the column vectors of a matrix
03253 
03254  *******************************************************************************
03255  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03256 
03257  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
03258  \param[in]     w                : weight vector a
03259  \param[out]    b                : vector containing the summed columns of a
03260 
03261  ******************************************************************************/
03262 int
03263 mat_sum_columns_weighted(Matrix a, Vector w, Vector b){
03264   int i,j;
03265   int ar,ac,wr,br;
03266   int type;
03267 
03268   ar   = a[0][NR];
03269   ac   = a[0][NC];
03270   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE];
03271   wr   = w[NR];
03272   br   = b[NR];
03273 
03274   if(ac != wr){
03275     fprintf(stderr,"ERROR: Incorrect length of weight vector in >mat_sum_columns_weighted<");
03276     return FALSE;
03277   }
03278   if(ar != br){
03279     fprintf(stderr,"ERROR: Incorrect length of destination vector in >mat_sum_columns_weighted<");
03280     return FALSE;
03281   }
03282 
03283   vec_zero(b);
03284 
03285   switch(type){
03286   case IS_FULL:
03287     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
03288       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++)
03289         b[i] += w[j]*a[i][j];
03290     break;
03291 
03292   case IS_SYMM:
03293     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++){
03294       for(j=1; j<i; j++)
03295         b[i] += w[j]*a[j][i];
03296       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++)
03297         b[i] += w[j]*a[i][j];
03298     }
03299     break;
03300 
03301   case IS_DIAG:
03302     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
03303       b[i] = w[i]*a[i][i];
03304     break;
03305 
03306   default:
03307     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Unrecognized matrix type in >mat_sum_columns_weighted<");
03308     exit(-12);
03309   }
03310 
03311   return TRUE;
03312 }

03314 /*!*****************************************************************************
03315  *******************************************************************************
03316  \note  mat_mahal_matrix
03317  \date  August 22, 2002
03318  
03319  \remarks 
03320  
03321  calculates b a b' where a and b are both matrices
03322 
03323  *******************************************************************************
03324  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03325  
03326  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
03327  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
03328  \param[out]    c               : matrix c
03329  ******************************************************************************/
03330 int
03331 mat_mahal_matrix(Matrix a, Matrix b, Matrix c){
03332   int i,j,k;
03333   int ar,br,cr,ac,bc,cc;
03334   int type;
03335   double temp;
03336 
03337   ar = a[0][NR];
03338   ac = a[0][NC];
03339   br = b[0][NR];
03340   bc = b[0][NC];
03341   cr = c[0][NR];
03342   cc = c[0][NC];
03343 
03344   if(bc!=ar || ar!=ac){
03345     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible input matrix sizes in >mat_mahal_matrix<");
03346     return FALSE;
03347   }
03348   if(cr!=cc || cr!=br){
03349     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix size in >mat_mahal_matrix<");
03350     return FALSE;
03351   }
03352   if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]>a[0][MAT_TYPE] || c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG){
03353     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible output matrix type in >mat_mahal_matrix<");
03354     return FALSE;
03355   }
03356 
03357   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE]*10+b[0][MAT_TYPE];
03358 
03359   mat_zero(c);
03360 
03361   switch(type){
03362   case FULL_FULL:
03363     for(i=1; i<=br; i++)
03364       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++){
03365         temp = 0.0;
03366         for(k=1; k<=bc; k++)
03367           temp += b[i][k]*a[k][j];
03368         for(k=1; k<=br; k++)
03369           c[i][k] += temp*b[k][j];
03370       }
03371     break;
03372 
03373   case FULL_SYMM:
03374     break;
03375 
03376   case FULL_DIAG:
03377     break;
03378 
03379   case SYMM_FULL:
03380     for(i=1; i<=br; i++)
03381       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++){
03382         temp = 0.0;
03383         for(k=1; k<=j; k++)
03384           temp += b[i][k]*a[k][j];
03385         for(k=j+1; k<=bc; k++)
03386           temp += b[i][k]*a[j][k];
03387 
03388         for(k=i; k<=br; k++)
03389           c[i][k] += temp*b[k][j];
03390       }
03391 
03392     if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL){
03393       for(i=1; i<=cr; i++)
03394         for(j=i+1; j<=cc; j++)
03395           c[j][i] = c[i][j];
03396     }
03397     break;
03398 
03399   case SYMM_SYMM:
03400     break;
03401 
03402   case SYMM_DIAG:
03403     break;
03404 
03405   case DIAG_FULL:
03406     break;
03407 
03408   case DIAG_SYMM:
03409     break;
03410 
03411   case DIAG_DIAG:
03412     break;
03413 
03414   }
03415 
03416   return TRUE;
03417 }
03418 
03419 /*!*****************************************************************************
03420  *******************************************************************************
03421  \note  mat_mahal
03422  \date  August 17, 92
03423  
03424  \remarks 
03425  
03426  calculates b'a b, i.e., the mahalanobis distance
03427 
03428  *******************************************************************************
03429  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03430  
03431  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
03432  \param[in]     b                : vector b
03433  
03434  ******************************************************************************/
03435 double   
03436 mat_mahal(Matrix a, Vector b)
03437 
03438 {
03439   int    i,j;
03440   double mahal=0.0;
03441   int    nr;
03442 
03443   nr = b[NR];
03444 
03445   if (a[0][NR]!=b[NR] || a[0][NC]!=b[NR]) {
03446     printf("Incompatible matrix vector combination in mat_mahal\n");
03447     return 0.0;
03448   }
03449 
03450   switch ((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
03451 
03452   case IS_SYMM:
03453 
03454     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
03455       for (j=i; j<=nr; ++j) {
03456         if (i == j) {
03457           mahal += a[i][j]*b[i]*b[j];
03458         } else {
03459           mahal += 2.*a[i][j]*b[i]*b[j];
03460         }
03461       }
03462     }
03463 
03464     break;
03465 
03466 
03467   case IS_DIAG:
03468 
03469     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
03470       mahal += a[i][i]*b[i]*b[i];
03471     }
03472 
03473     break;
03474 
03475 
03476   case IS_FULL:
03477 
03478     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
03479       for (j=1; j<=nr; ++j) {
03480         mahal += a[i][j]*b[i]*b[j];
03481       }
03482     }
03483 
03484     break;
03485 
03486 
03487   default:
03488 
03489     exit(-15);
03490 
03491   }
03492 
03493   return (mahal);
03494 }
03495 
03496 /*!*****************************************************************************
03497  *******************************************************************************
03498  \note  mat_mahal_irr
03499  \date  August 17, 92
03500  
03501  \remarks 
03502  
03503  calculates c' a  b, i.e., the "irregular mahalanobis distance"
03504 
03505  *******************************************************************************
03506  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03507  
03508  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
03509  \param[in]     b                : vector b
03510  \param[in]     c                : vector c
03511  
03512  ******************************************************************************/
03513 double   
03514 mat_mahal_irr(Vector c, Matrix a, Vector b)
03515 
03516 {
03517   int i,j;
03518   double mahal=0.0;
03519   int    nr,nc;
03520 
03521   nr = a[0][NR];
03522   nc = a[0][NC];
03523 
03524   if (nr!=c[NR] || nc!=b[NR]) {
03525     printf("Incompatible matrix vector combination in mat_mahal_irr\n");
03526     return 0.0;
03527   }
03528 
03529 
03530 
03531   switch ((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
03532 
03533   case IS_FULL:
03534 
03535     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
03536       for (j=1; j<=nc; ++j) {
03537         mahal += a[i][j]*c[i]*b[j];
03538       }
03539     }
03540 
03541     break;
03542 
03543 
03544   case IS_DIAG:
03545 
03546     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
03547       mahal += a[i][i]*c[i]*b[i];
03548     }
03549 
03550     break;
03551 
03552 
03553   case IS_SYMM:
03554 
03555     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
03556       for (j=i; j<=nc; ++j) {
03557         if (i==j) {
03558           mahal += a[i][j]*c[i]*b[j];
03559         } else {
03560           mahal += a[i][j]*c[i]*(b[j]+b[i]);
03561         }
03562       }
03563     }
03564 
03565     break;
03566 
03567 
03568   default:
03569 
03570     exit(-16);
03571 
03572   }
03573 
03574 
03575   return (mahal);
03576 }
03577 
03578 /*!*****************************************************************************
03579  *******************************************************************************
03580  \note  vec_mult_inner
03581  \date  August 17, 92
03582  
03583  \remarks 
03584  
03585  inner product a' * b, return result
03586 vector indices start at "1".
03587 
03588  *******************************************************************************
03589 Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03590 
03591  \param[in]     a                : vector a
03592  \param[in]     b                : vector b
03593 
03594  ******************************************************************************/
03595 double  
03596 vec_mult_inner(Vector a, Vector b)
03597 
03598 {
03599 
03600   double aux = 0;
03601   int i;
03602 
03603   if (a[NR] != b[NR]) {
03604     printf("Incompatible vectors in vec_mult_inner\n");
03605     return 0.0;
03606   }
03607 
03608   for (i=1; i<=a[NR]; ++i) aux += a[i] * b[i];
03609 
03610   return aux;
03611 
03612 }
03613 
03614 /*!*****************************************************************************
03615  *******************************************************************************
03616  \note  vec_mult_inner_size
03617  \date  August 17, 92
03618  
03619  \remarks 
03620  
03621  inner product a' * b, return result
03622 vector indices start at "1".
03623 
03624  *******************************************************************************
03625 Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03626 
03627  \param[in]     a                : vector a
03628  \param[in]     b                : vector b
03629  \param[in]     nr               : number for rows
03630 
03631  ******************************************************************************/
03632 double  
03633 vec_mult_inner_size(Vector a, Vector b, int nr)
03634 
03635 {
03636 
03637   double aux = 0;
03638   int i;
03639 
03640   for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) aux += a[i] * b[i];
03641 
03642   return aux;
03643 
03644 }
03645 
03646 /*!*****************************************************************************
03647  *******************************************************************************
03648  \note  vec_mult_outer
03649  \date  Sept. 2005
03650  
03651  \remarks 
03652  
03653  outer product c = a x b
03654  vector indices start at "1". c can be the same as one of the calling vectors
03655 
03656  *******************************************************************************
03657 Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03658 
03659  \param[in]     a                : vector a
03660  \param[in]     b                : vector b
03661  \param[out]    c                : vector c
03662 
03663  ******************************************************************************/
03664 int  
03665 vec_mult_outer(Vector a, Vector b, Vector c)
03666 
03667 {
03668 
03669   double aux[3+1];
03670   int i;
03671 
03672   if (a[NR] != b[NR]) {
03673     printf("Incompatible vectors in vec_mult_inner\n");
03674     return FALSE;
03675   }
03676 
03677   if (a[NR] != 3) {
03678     printf("Outer product only defined for 3 dimensional vectors\n");
03679     return FALSE;
03680   }
03681 
03682   aux[1] = a[2]*b[3]-a[3]*b[2];
03683   aux[2] = a[3]*b[1]-a[1]*b[3];
03684   aux[3] = a[1]*b[2]-a[2]*b[1];
03685 
03686   for (i=1; i<=3; ++i)
03687     c[i] = aux[i];
03688 
03689   return TRUE;
03690 
03691 }
03692 
03693 /*!*****************************************************************************
03694  *******************************************************************************
03695  \note  vec_mult_outer_size
03696  \date  Sept. 2005
03697  
03698  \remarks 
03699  
03700  outer product c = a x b
03701  vector indices start at "1". c can be the same as one of the calling vectors
03702 
03703  *******************************************************************************
03704 Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03705 
03706  \param[in]     a                : vector a
03707  \param[in]     b                : vector b
03708  \param[in]     nr               : number of rows in vectors
03709  \param[out]    c                : vector c
03710 
03711  ******************************************************************************/
03712 int
03713 vec_mult_outer_size(Vector a, Vector b, int nr, Vector c)
03714 
03715 {
03716 
03717   double aux[3+1];
03718   int i;
03719 
03720   if (nr != 3) {
03721     printf("Outer product only defined for 3 dimensional vectors\n");
03722     return FALSE;
03723   }
03724 
03725   aux[1] = a[2]*b[3]-a[3]*b[2];
03726   aux[2] = a[3]*b[1]-a[1]*b[3];
03727   aux[3] = a[1]*b[2]-a[2]*b[1];
03728 
03729   for (i=1; i<=3; ++i)
03730     c[i] = aux[i];
03731 
03732   return TRUE;
03733 
03734 }
03735 
03736 /*!*****************************************************************************
03737  *******************************************************************************
03738 \note  vec_mult_scalar
03739 \date  August 17, 92
03740 
03741 \remarks 
03742 
03743 product of vector a  * scalar = c
03744 vector indices start at "1".
03745 
03746  *******************************************************************************
03747 Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03748 
03749  \param[in]     a                : vector a
03750  \param[in]     scalar           : value by which a is to be multiplied with
03751  \param[out]    c                : vector c (result)
03752 
03753  ******************************************************************************/
03754 void  
03755 vec_mult_scalar(Vector a, double scalar, Vector c)
03756 
03757 {
03758 
03759   double aux = 0;
03760   int i;
03761 
03762   for (i=1; i<=a[NR]; ++i) c[i] = a[i] * scalar;
03763 
03764 }
03765 
03766 /*!*****************************************************************************
03767  *******************************************************************************
03768 \note  vec_mult_scalar_size
03769 \date  August 17, 92
03770 
03771 \remarks 
03772 
03773 product of vector a  * scalar = c
03774 vector indices start at "1".
03775 
03776  *******************************************************************************
03777 Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03778 
03779  \param[in]     a                : vector a
03780  \param[in]     nr               : number of rows in a
03781  \param[in]     scalar           : value by which a is to be multiplied with
03782  \param[out]    c                : vector c (result)
03783 
03784  ******************************************************************************/
03785 void  
03786 vec_mult_scalar_size(Vector a, int nr, double scalar, Vector c)
03787 
03788 {
03789 
03790   double aux = 0;
03791   int i;
03792 
03793   for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) c[i] = a[i] * scalar;
03794 
03795 }
03796 
03797 /*!*****************************************************************************
03798  *******************************************************************************
03799 \note  mat_mult_scalar
03800 \date  August 17, 92
03801 
03802 \remarks 
03803 
03804 product of matrix a  * scalar = c
03805 vector indices start at "1".
03806 
03807  *******************************************************************************
03808 Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
03809 
03810  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
03811  \param[in]     scalar           : value by which a is to be multiplied with
03812  \param[out]    c                : matrix c (result)
03813 
03814  ******************************************************************************/
03815 int
03816 mat_mult_scalar(Matrix a, double scalar, Matrix c)
03817 
03818 {
03819 
03820   double aux = 0;
03821   int i,j;
03822 
03823   if (a[0][NR]!=c[0][NR] || a[0][NC]!=c[0][NC] || 
03824       c[0][MAT_TYPE] > a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
03825     printf("Incompatible matrices in mat_mult_scalar\n");
03826     return FALSE;
03827   }
03828 
03829   if (a!=c)
03830     mat_equal(a,c);
03831   
03832   switch ((int)c[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
03833     
03834   case IS_FULL:
03835 
03836     for (i=1; i<=c[0][NR]; ++i) {
03837       for (j=1; j<=a[0][NC]; ++j) {
03838         c[i][j] *= scalar;
03839       }
03840     }
03841 
03842     break;
03843 
03844   case IS_DIAG:
03845 
03846     for (i=1; i<=c[0][NR]; ++i) {
03847       c[i][i] *= scalar;
03848     }
03849 
03850     break;
03851 
03852 
03853   case IS_SYMM:
03854 
03855     for (i=1; i<=c[0][NR]; ++i) {
03856       for (j=i; j<=c[0][NC]; ++j) {
03857         c[i][j] *= scalar;
03858       }
03859     }
03860 
03861     break;
03862 
03863   }
03864 
03865   return TRUE;
03866   
03867 }
03868

03870  *******************************************************************************
03871 \note  mat_equal_scalar
03872 \date  August 17, 92
03873 
03874 \remarks 
03875

03877 vector indices start at "1".
03878

03883  \param[out]    c                : matrix c (result)
03884 
03885  ******************************************************************************/
03886 int
03887 mat_equal_scalar(double scalar, Matrix c)
03888 
03889 {
03890 
03891   double aux = 0;
03892   int i,j;
03893 
03894   switch ((int)c[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
03895     
03896   case IS_FULL:
03897 
03898     for (i=1; i<=c[0][NR]; ++i) {
03899       for (j=1; j<=c[0][NC]; ++j) {
03900         c[i][j] = scalar;
03901       }
03902     }
03903 
03904     break;
03905 
03906   case IS_DIAG:
03907 
03908     for (i=1; i<=c[0][NR]; ++i) {
03909       c[i][i] = scalar;
03910     }
03911 
03912     break;
03913 
03914 
03915   case IS_SYMM:
03916 
03917     for (i=1; i<=c[0][NR]; ++i) {
03918       for (j=i; j<=c[0][NC]; ++j) {
03919         c[i][j] = scalar;
03920       }
03921     }
03922 
03923     break;
03924 
03925   }
03926 
03927   return TRUE;
03928

04003 /*!*****************************************************************************
04004  *******************************************************************************
04005 \note  mat_equal_apply_math
04006 \date  August 17, 92
04007 
04008 \remarks 
04009 
04010  applies a given (double) function to each element of the matrix
04011 
04012  *******************************************************************************
04013 Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
04014 
04015  \param[in]     a                  : matrix a
04016  \param[in]     func               : (double) function pointer to be applied
04017  \param[out]    c                  : output matrix
04018 
04019  ******************************************************************************/
04020 int
04021 mat_equal_apply_math(Matrix a, double (*func)(double), Matrix c)
04022 
04023 {
04024 
04025   double aux = 0;
04026   int i,j;
04027 
04028   if (a[0][NR]!=c[0][NR] || a[0][NC]!=c[0][NC] || 
04029       c[0][MAT_TYPE] > a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
04030     printf("Incompatible matrices in mat_mult_scalar\n");
04031     return FALSE;
04032   }
04033 
04034   if (a!=c)
04035     mat_equal(a,c);
04036 
04037   switch ((int)c[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
04038     
04039   case IS_FULL:
04040 
04041     for (i=1; i<=c[0][NR]; ++i) {
04042       for (j=1; j<=c[0][NC]; ++j) {
04043         c[i][j] = (*func)(c[i][j]);
04044       }
04045     }
04046 
04047     break;
04048 
04049   case IS_DIAG:
04050 
04051     for (i=1; i<=c[0][NR]; ++i) {
04052       c[i][i] = (*func)(c[i][i]);
04053     }
04054 
04055     break;
04056 
04057 
04058   case IS_SYMM:
04059 
04060     for (i=1; i<=c[0][NR]; ++i) {
04061       for (j=i; j<=c[0][NC]; ++j) {
04062         c[i][j] = (*func)(c[i][j]);
04063       }
04064     }
04065 
04066     break;
04067 
04068   }
04069 
04070   return TRUE;
04071   
04072 }
04073

04081  applies a given (double) function to each element of the matrix
04082

04087  \param[in]     func               : (float) function pointer to be applied
04088  \param[out]    c                  : output matrix
04089 
04090  ******************************************************************************/
04091 int
04092 fmat_equal_apply_math(fMatrix a, float (*func)(float), fMatrix c)
04093

04100       c[0][MAT_TYPE] > a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
04101     printf("Incompatible matrices in mat_mult_scalar\n");
04102     return FALSE;

04124     }
04125 
04126     break;
04127

04130 
04131     for (i=1; i<=c[0][NR]; ++i) {
04132       for (j=i; j<=c[0][NC]; ++j) {
04133         c[i][j] = (*func)(c[i][j]);

04137     break;

04141   return TRUE;
04142

04144 
04145 /*!*****************************************************************************
04146  *******************************************************************************
04147 \note  vec_mat_mult
04148 \date  August 17, 92
04149 
04150 \remarks 
04151 
04152 multiplies a vector with a matrix: a * b, assuming indices
04153 start at "1".
04154 Note: The program can also cope with passing the same vector as
04155 factor and result.
04156 
04157  *******************************************************************************
04158 Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
04159 
04160  \param[in]     a                : vector a
04161  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
04162  \param[out]    c                : result of multipliciation
04163 
04164  ******************************************************************************/
04165 int
04166 vec_mat_mult(Vector a, Matrix b, Vector c)
04167 
04168 {
04169 
04170   int     i,j,m;
04171   Vector  temp;
04172   int     ar,bc,br;
04173 
04174   ar = a[NR];
04175   br = b[0][NR];
04176   bc = b[0][NC];
04177   
04178   if (ar != br) {
04179     printf("Matrix and vector are incompatible in mat_vec_mult.\n");
04180     return FALSE;
04181   }
04182 
04183   if (c[NR] != bc) {
04184     printf("Output vector is incompatible in mat_vec_mult.\n");
04185     return FALSE;
04186   }
04187 
04188   if (a == c) {
04189     temp = my_vector(1,bc);
04190   } else {
04191     temp = c;
04192   }
04193 
04194   switch ((int)b[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
04195 
04196   case IS_FULL:
04197   
04198     for (i=1; i <= bc; ++i) {
04199       temp[i]=0;
04200       for (j=1; j <= br; ++j){
04201         temp[i] += a[j] * b[j][i];
04202       }
04203     }
04204     
04205     break;
04206 
04207 
04208   case IS_DIAG:
04209 
04210     for (i=1; i <= bc; ++i) {
04211       temp[i] = a[i] * b[i][i];
04212     }
04213     
04214     break;
04215 
04216 
04217   case IS_SYMM:
04218 
04219     for (i=1; i <= bc; ++i) {
04220       temp[i]=0;
04221       for (j=i; j <= br; ++j){
04222         temp[i] += a[j] * b[i][j];
04223         if (i!=j)
04224           temp[j] += a[i] * b[i][j];
04225       }
04226     }
04227 
04228     break;
04229 
04230 
04231   default:
04232 
04233     exit(-17);
04234 
04235   }
04236 
04237 
04238   if (a == c) {
04239     vec_equal(temp,c);
04240     my_free_vector(temp,1,bc);
04241   }
04242 
04243   return TRUE;
04244 
04245 }
04246 
04247 /*!*****************************************************************************
04248  *******************************************************************************
04249  \note  mat_add
04250  \date  August 17, 92
04251  
04252  \remarks 
04253  
04254  adds two arbitrary (compatible) matrices a + b, assuming the
04255  matrix indices start at "1".
04256  Note: if a vector is passed, it must be the pointer to the vector;
04257  everything is handled as a matrix!
04258  programs can use overlapping input and output matrices
04259  
04260  *******************************************************************************
04261  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
04262  
04263  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
04264  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
04265  \param[out]    c                : result of addition
04266  
04267  ******************************************************************************/
04268 int
04269 mat_add(Matrix a, Matrix b, Matrix c)
04270 
04271 {
04272   int      i,j;
04273   Matrix   temp;
04274   int      nr,nc;
04275   int      type;
04276 
04277   temp = c;
04278 
04279   if (a[0][NR] != b[0][NR] || a[0][NC] != b[0][NC] ||
04280       a[0][NR] != c[0][NR] || a[0][NC] != c[0][NC]) {
04281     printf("Incompatible matrices in mat_add\n");
04282     return FALSE;
04283   }
04284 
04285   if (c[0][MAT_TYPE] > a[0][MAT_TYPE] || c[0][MAT_TYPE] > b[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
04286     printf("Incompatible matrix types in mat_add\n");
04287     return FALSE;
04288   }
04289 
04290   nr = a[0][NR];
04291   nc = a[0][NC];
04292 
04293   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE]*10+b[0][MAT_TYPE];
04294 
04295   switch (type) {
04296 
04297   case FULL_FULL:
04298 
04299     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04300       for (j=1; j <= nc; ++j){
04301         temp[i][j] = a[i][j] + b[i][j];
04302       }
04303     }
04304 
04305     break;
04306 
04307 
04308   case FULL_DIAG:
04309 
04310     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04311       for (j=1; j <= nc; ++j){
04312         temp[i][j] = a[i][j];
04313         if (i==j)
04314           temp[i][j] += b[i][j];
04315       }
04316     }
04317 
04318     break;
04319 
04320 
04321   case FULL_SYMM:
04322 
04323     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04324       for (j=i; j <= nc; ++j){
04325         temp[i][j] = a[i][j] + b[i][j];
04326         if (i!=j)
04327           temp[j][i] = a[j][i] + b[i][j];
04328       }
04329     }
04330 
04331     break;
04332     
04333 
04334   case DIAG_FULL:
04335 
04336     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04337       for (j=1; j <= nc; ++j){
04338         temp[i][j] = b[i][j];
04339         if (i==j)
04340           temp[i][j] += a[i][j];
04341       }
04342     }
04343 
04344     break;
04345 
04346 
04347   case DIAG_DIAG:
04348 
04349     if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE] != IS_DIAG)
04350       mat_zero(temp);
04351 
04352     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04353       temp[i][i] = a[i][i] + b[i][i];
04354     }
04355 
04356     break;
04357 
04358 
04359   case DIAG_SYMM:
04360 
04361     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04362       for (j=i; j <= nc; ++j){
04363         temp[i][j] = b[i][j];
04364         if (i==j)
04365           temp[i][j] += a[i][j];
04366         else if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE] == IS_FULL)
04367           temp[j][i] = b[i][j];
04368       }
04369     }
04370 
04371     break;
04372 
04373 
04374   case SYMM_FULL:
04375 
04376     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04377       for (j=i; j <= nc; ++j){
04378         temp[i][j] = a[i][j] + b[i][j];
04379         if (i!=j)
04380           temp[j][i] = a[i][j] + b[j][i];
04381       }
04382     }
04383 
04384     break;
04385 
04386 
04387   case SYMM_DIAG:
04388 
04389     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04390       for (j=i; j <= nc; ++j){
04391         temp[i][j] = a[i][j];
04392         if (i==j)
04393           temp[i][j] += b[i][j];
04394         else if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE] == IS_FULL)
04395           temp[j][i] = a[i][j];
04396       }
04397     }
04398 
04399     break;
04400 
04401 
04402   case SYMM_SYMM:
04403 
04404     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04405       for (j=i; j <= nc; ++j){
04406         temp[i][j] = a[i][j] + b[i][j];
04407         if (i!=j && temp[0][MAT_TYPE] == IS_FULL)
04408           temp[j][i] = temp[i][j];
04409       }
04410     }
04411 
04412     break;
04413 
04414 
04415   default:
04416 
04417     exit(-18);
04418 
04419   }
04420 
04421   return TRUE;
04422 
04423 }
04424 
04425 /*!*****************************************************************************
04426  *******************************************************************************
04427  \note  mat_add_size
04428  \date  August 17, 92
04429  
04430  \remarks 
04431  
04432  adds two arbitrary (compatible) matrices a + b, assuming the
04433  matrix indices start at "1".
04434  Note: if a vector is passed, it must be the pointer to the vector;
04435  everything is handled as a matrix!
04436  programs can use overlapping input and output matrices
04437  
04438  *******************************************************************************
04439  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
04440  
04441  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
04442  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
04443  \param[in]     nr              : number of rows
04444  \param[in]     nc              : number of columns
04445  \param[out]    c                : result of addition
04446  
04447  ******************************************************************************/
04448 int
04449 mat_add_size(Matrix a, Matrix b, int nr, int nc, Matrix c)
04450 
04451 {
04452   int      i,j;
04453 
04454   for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04455     for (j=1; j <= nc; ++j){
04456       c[i][j] = a[i][j] + b[i][j];
04457     }
04458   }
04459 
04460   return TRUE;
04461 
04462 }
04463 
04464 /*!*****************************************************************************
04465  *******************************************************************************
04466  \note  mat_add_vector_rows
04467  \date  July 18, 2002
04468  
04469  \remarks 
04470  
04471  Add a vector to each row of the matrix
04472 
04473  *******************************************************************************
04474  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
04475 
04476  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
04477  \param[in]     b                : vector b to be added
04478  \param[out]    c                : result matrix c
04479 
04480  ******************************************************************************/
04481 int
04482 mat_add_vec_rows(Matrix a, Vector b, Matrix c){
04483   int i,j;
04484   int ar,ac,br,cr,cc;
04485 
04486   ar = a[0][NR];
04487   ac = a[0][NC];
04488   br = b[NR];
04489   cr = c[0][NR];
04490   cc = c[0][NC];
04491 
04492   if(cr!=ar || cc!=ac){
04493     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible matrix sizes in >mat_add_vec_rows<");
04494     return FALSE;
04495   }
04496   if(br!=ac){
04497     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible vector size in >mat_add_vec_rows<");
04498     return FALSE;
04499   }
04500   if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]!=IS_FULL){
04501     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible matrix type in >mat_add_vec_rows<");
04502     return FALSE;
04503   }
04504 
04505   switch((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]){
04506   case IS_FULL:
04507     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
04508       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++)
04509         c[i][j] = a[i][j] + b[j];
04510     break;
04511 
04512   case IS_SYMM:
04513     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++){
04514       for(j=1; j<i; j++)
04515         c[i][j] = a[j][i] + b[j];
04516       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++)
04517         c[i][j] = a[i][j] + b[j];
04518     }
04519     break;
04520 
04521   case IS_DIAG:
04522     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++){
04523       for(j=1; j<i; j++)
04524         c[i][j] = b[j];
04525       c[i][i] = a[i][i] + b[i];
04526       for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
04527         c[i][j] = b[j];
04528     }
04529     break;
04530 
04531   default:
04532     fprintf(stderr, "ABORT: Unknown matrix type in >mat_add_vec_rows<");
04533     exit(-12);
04534   }
04535 
04536   return TRUE;
04537 }
04538 
04539 /*!*****************************************************************************
04540  *******************************************************************************
04541  \note  mat_add_vector_columns
04542  \date  July 18, 2002
04543  
04544  \remarks 
04545  
04546  Adds a vector to each column of the matrix
04547 
04548  *******************************************************************************
04549  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
04550 
04551  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
04552  \param[in]     b                : vector b to be added
04553  \param[out]    c                : result matrix c
04554 
04555  ******************************************************************************/
04556 int
04557 mat_add_vec_columns(Matrix a, Vector b, Matrix c){
04558   int i,j;
04559   int ar,ac,br,cr,cc;
04560 
04561   ar = a[0][NR];
04562   ac = a[0][NC];
04563   br = b[NR];
04564   cr = c[0][NR];
04565   cc = c[0][NC];
04566 
04567   if(cr!=ar || cc!=ac){
04568     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible matrix sizes in >mat_add_vec_columns<");
04569     return FALSE;
04570   }
04571   if(br!=ar){
04572     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible vector size in >mat_add_vec_columns<");
04573     return FALSE;
04574   }
04575   if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]!=IS_FULL){
04576     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Require FULL destination matrix in >mat_add_vec_columns<");
04577     return FALSE;
04578   }
04579 
04580   switch((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]){
04581   case IS_FULL:
04582     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
04583       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++)
04584         c[i][j] = a[i][j] + b[i];
04585     break;
04586 
04587   case IS_SYMM:
04588     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++){
04589       for(j=1; j<i; j++)
04590         c[i][j] = a[j][i] + b[i];
04591       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++)
04592         c[i][j] = a[i][j] + b[i];
04593     }
04594     break;
04595 
04596   case IS_DIAG:
04597     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++){
04598       for(j=1; j<i; j++)
04599         c[i][j] = b[i];
04600       c[i][i] = a[i][i] + b[i];
04601       for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
04602         c[i][j] = b[i];
04603     }
04604     break;
04605 
04606   default:
04607     fprintf(stderr, "ABORT: Unknown matrix type in >mat_add_vec_columns<");
04608     exit(-12);
04609   }
04610 
04611   return TRUE;
04612 }
04613 
04614 /*!*****************************************************************************
04615  *******************************************************************************
04616  \note  mat_sub
04617  \date  August 17, 92
04618  
04619  \remarks 
04620  
04621  subtracts two arbitrary (compatible) matrices a - b, assuming the
04622  matrix indices start at "1".
04623  Note: if a vector is passed, it must be the pointer to the vector;
04624  everything is handled as a matrix!
04625  
04626  *******************************************************************************
04627  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
04628  
04629  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
04630  \param[in]     b                : matrix b
04631  \param[out]    c                : result of addition
04632  
04633  ******************************************************************************/
04634 int
04635 mat_sub(Matrix a, Matrix b, Matrix c)
04636 
04637 {
04638   int      i,j;
04639   Matrix   temp;
04640   int      nr,nc;
04641   int      type;
04642 
04643   temp = c;
04644 
04645   if (a[0][NR] != b[0][NR] || a[0][NC] != b[0][NC] ||
04646       a[0][NR] != c[0][NR] || a[0][NC] != c[0][NC]) {
04647     printf("Incompatible matrices in mat_sub\n");
04648     return FALSE;
04649   }
04650 
04651   if (c[0][MAT_TYPE] > a[0][MAT_TYPE] || c[0][MAT_TYPE] > b[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
04652     printf("Incompatible matrix types in mat_sub\n");
04653     return FALSE;
04654   }
04655 
04656   nr = a[0][NR];
04657   nc = a[0][NC];
04658 
04659   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE]*10+b[0][MAT_TYPE];
04660 
04661   switch (type) {
04662 
04663   case FULL_FULL:
04664 
04665     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04666       for (j=1; j <= nc; ++j){
04667         temp[i][j] = a[i][j] - b[i][j];
04668       }
04669     }
04670 
04671     break;
04672 
04673 
04674   case FULL_DIAG:
04675 
04676     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04677       for (j=1; j <= nc; ++j){
04678         temp[i][j] = a[i][j];
04679         if (i==j)
04680           temp[i][j] -= b[i][j];
04681       }
04682     }
04683 
04684     break;
04685 
04686 
04687   case FULL_SYMM:
04688 
04689     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04690       for (j=i; j <= nc; ++j){
04691         temp[i][j] = a[i][j] - b[i][j];
04692         if (i!=j)
04693           temp[j][i] = a[j][i] - b[i][j];
04694       }
04695     }
04696 
04697     break;
04698     
04699 
04700   case DIAG_FULL:
04701 
04702     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04703       for (j=1; j <= nc; ++j){
04704         temp[i][j] = b[i][j];
04705         if (i==j)
04706           temp[i][j] -= a[i][j];
04707       }
04708     }
04709 
04710     break;
04711 
04712 
04713   case DIAG_DIAG:
04714 
04715     if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE] != IS_DIAG)
04716       mat_zero(temp);
04717 
04718     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04719       temp[i][i] = a[i][i] - b[i][i];
04720     }
04721 
04722     break;
04723 
04724 
04725   case DIAG_SYMM:
04726 
04727     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04728       for (j=i; j <= nc; ++j){
04729         temp[i][j] = b[i][j];
04730         if (i==j)
04731           temp[i][j] -= a[i][j];
04732         else if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE] == IS_FULL)
04733           temp[j][i] = b[i][j];
04734       }
04735     }
04736 
04737     break;
04738 
04739 
04740   case SYMM_FULL:
04741 
04742     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04743       for (j=i; j <= nc; ++j){
04744         temp[i][j] = a[i][j] - b[i][j];
04745         if (i!=j)
04746           temp[j][i] = a[i][j] - b[j][i];
04747       }
04748     }
04749 
04750     break;
04751 
04752 
04753   case SYMM_DIAG:
04754 
04755     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04756       for (j=i; j <= nc; ++j){
04757         temp[i][j] = a[i][j];
04758         if (i==j)
04759           temp[i][j] -= b[i][j];
04760         else if (temp[0][MAT_TYPE] == IS_FULL)
04761           temp[j][i] = a[i][j];
04762       }
04763     }
04764 
04765     break;
04766 
04767 
04768   case SYMM_SYMM:
04769 
04770     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
04771       for (j=i; j <= nc; ++j){
04772         temp[i][j] = a[i][j] - b[i][j];
04773         if (i!=j && temp[0][MAT_TYPE] == IS_FULL)
04774           temp[j][i] = temp[i][j];
04775       }
04776     }
04777 
04778     break;
04779 
04780 
04781   default:
04782 
04783     exit(-19);
04784 
04785   }
04786 
04787   return TRUE;
04788 
04789 }
04790 
04791 /*!*****************************************************************************
04792  *******************************************************************************
04793  \note  mat_sub_vector_rows
04794  \date  July 18, 2002
04795  
04796  \remarks 
04797  
04798  Subtracts a vector from each row of the matrix
04799 
04800  *******************************************************************************
04801  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
04802 
04803  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
04804  \param[in]     b                : vector b to be subtracted
04805  \param[out]    c                : result matrix c
04806 
04807  ******************************************************************************/
04808 int
04809 mat_sub_vec_rows(Matrix a, Vector b, Matrix c){
04810   int i,j;
04811   int ar,ac,br,cr,cc;
04812 
04813   ar = a[0][NR];
04814   ac = a[0][NC];
04815   br = b[NR];
04816   cr = c[0][NR];
04817   cc = c[0][NC];
04818 
04819   if(cr!=ar || cc!=ac){
04820     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible matrix sizes in >mat_sub_vec_rows<");
04821     return FALSE;
04822   }
04823   if(br!=ac){
04824     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible vector size in >mat_sub_vec_rows<");
04825     return FALSE;
04826   }
04827   if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]!=IS_FULL){
04828     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible matrix type in >mat_sub_vec_rows<");
04829     return FALSE;
04830   }
04831 
04832   switch((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]){
04833   case IS_FULL:
04834     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
04835       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++)
04836         c[i][j] = a[i][j] - b[j];
04837     break;
04838 
04839   case IS_SYMM:
04840     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++){
04841       for(j=1; j<i; j++)
04842         c[i][j] = a[j][i] - b[j];
04843       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++)
04844         c[i][j] = a[i][j] - b[j];
04845     }
04846     break;
04847 
04848   case IS_DIAG:
04849     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++){
04850       for(j=1; j<i; j++)
04851         c[i][j] = -b[j];
04852       c[i][i] = a[i][i] - b[i];
04853       for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
04854         c[i][j] = -b[j];
04855     }
04856     break;
04857 
04858   default:
04859     fprintf(stderr, "ABORT: Unknown matrix type in >mat_sub_vec_rows<");
04860     exit(-12);
04861   }
04862 
04863   return TRUE;
04864 }
04865 
04866 /*!*****************************************************************************
04867  *******************************************************************************
04868  \note  mat_sub_vector_columns
04869  \date  July 18, 2002
04870  
04871  \remarks 
04872  
04873  Subtracts a vector from each column of the matrix
04874 
04875  *******************************************************************************
04876  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
04877 
04878  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
04879  \param[in]     b                : vector b to be subtracted
04880  \param[out]    c                : result matrix c
04881 
04882  ******************************************************************************/
04883 int
04884 mat_sub_vec_columns(Matrix a, Vector b, Matrix c){
04885   int i,j;
04886   int ar,ac,br,cr,cc;
04887 
04888   ar = a[0][NR];
04889   ac = a[0][NC];
04890   br = b[NR];
04891   cr = c[0][NR];
04892   cc = c[0][NC];
04893 
04894   if(cr!=ar || cc!=ac){
04895     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible matrix sizes in >mat_sub_vec_columns<");
04896     return FALSE;
04897   }
04898   if(br!=ar){
04899     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible vector size in >mat_sub_vec_columns<");
04900     return FALSE;
04901   }
04902   if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]!=IS_FULL){
04903     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible matrix type in >mat_sub_vec_columns<");
04904     return FALSE;
04905   }
04906 
04907   switch((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]){
04908   case IS_FULL:
04909     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
04910       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++)
04911         c[i][j] = a[i][j] - b[i];
04912     break;
04913 
04914   case IS_SYMM:
04915     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++){
04916       for(j=1; j<i; j++)
04917         c[i][j] = a[j][i] - b[i];
04918       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++)
04919         c[i][j] = a[i][j] - b[i];
04920     }
04921     break;
04922 
04923   case IS_DIAG:
04924     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++){
04925       for(j=1; j<i; j++)
04926         c[i][j] = -b[i];
04927       c[i][i] = a[i][i] - b[i];
04928       for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
04929         c[i][j] = -b[i];
04930     }
04931     break;
04932 
04933   default:
04934     fprintf(stderr, "ABORT: Unknown matrix type in >mat_sub_vec_columns<");
04935     exit(-12);
04936   }
04937 
04938   return TRUE;
04939 }
04940 
04941 /*!*****************************************************************************
04942  *******************************************************************************
04943  \note  mat_equal
04944  \date  August 17, 92
04945  
04946  \remarks 
04947  
04948  set matrix c = a
04949  matrix indices start at "1".
04950  Note: if a vector is passed, it must be the pointer to the vector;
04951  everything is handled as a matrix!
04952  
04953  *******************************************************************************
04954  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
04955  
04956  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
04957  \param[out]    c                : result of addition
04958  
04959  ******************************************************************************/
04960 int
04961 mat_equal(Matrix a, Matrix c)
04962 
04963 {
04964   int i,j;
04965 
04966   if (a[0][NR] != c[0][NR] || a[0][NC] !=c[0][NC]) {
04967     printf("Incompatible matrices in mat_equal\n");
04968     return FALSE;
04969   }
04970 
04971   if (c[0][MAT_TYPE] > a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
04972     printf("Incompatible matrix types in mat_equal\n");
04973     return FALSE;
04974   }
04975 
04976 
04977   if (c[0][MAT_TYPE] < a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
04978     mat_zero(c);
04979   }
04980 
04981   switch ((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
04982 
04983   case IS_FULL:
04984 
04985     for (i=1; i <= a[0][NR]; ++i) {
04986       for (j=1; j <= a[0][NC]; ++j){
04987         c[i][j] = a[i][j];
04988       }
04989     }
04990 
04991     break;
04992 
04993 
04994   case IS_SYMM:
04995 
04996     for (i=1; i <= a[0][NR]; ++i) {
04997       for (j=i; j <= a[0][NC]; ++j){
04998         c[i][j] = a[i][j];
04999         if (c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL && i!=j)
05000           c[j][i] = a[i][j];
05001       }
05002     }
05003 
05004     break;
05005 
05006 
05007   case IS_DIAG:
05008 
05009     for (i=1; i <= a[0][NR]; ++i) {
05010       c[i][i] = a[i][i];
05011     }
05012 
05013     break;
05014 
05015 
05016   default:
05017 
05018     exit(-19);
05019 
05020   }
05021 
05022   return TRUE;
05023 
05024 }
05025 
05026 
05027 /*!*****************************************************************************
05028  *******************************************************************************
05029  \note  fmat_equal
05030  \date  August 17, 92
05031  
05032  \remarks 
05033  
05034  set matrix c = a
05035  matrix indices start at "1".
05036  Note: if a vector is passed, it must be the pointer to the vector;
05037  everything is handled as a matrix!
05038  
05039  *******************************************************************************
05040  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
05041  
05042  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
05043  \param[out]    c                : result of addition
05044  
05045  ******************************************************************************/
05046 int
05047 fmat_equal(fMatrix a, fMatrix c)
05048 
05049 {
05050   int i,j;
05051 
05052   if (a[0][NR] != c[0][NR] || a[0][NC] !=c[0][NC]) {
05053     printf("Incompatible matrices in mat_equal\n");
05054     return FALSE;
05055   }
05056 
05057   if (c[0][MAT_TYPE] > a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
05058     printf("Incompatible matrix types in mat_equal\n");
05059     return FALSE;
05060   }
05061 
05062 
05063   if (c[0][MAT_TYPE] < a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
05064     fmat_zero(c);
05065   }
05066 
05067   switch ((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
05068 
05069   case IS_FULL:
05070 
05071     for (i=1; i <= a[0][NR]; ++i) {
05072       for (j=1; j <= a[0][NC]; ++j){
05073         c[i][j] = a[i][j];
05074       }
05075     }
05076 
05077     break;
05078 
05079 
05080   case IS_SYMM:
05081 
05082     for (i=1; i <= a[0][NR]; ++i) {
05083       for (j=i; j <= a[0][NC]; ++j){
05084         c[i][j] = a[i][j];
05085         if (c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL && i!=j)
05086           c[j][i] = a[i][j];
05087       }
05088     }
05089 
05090     break;
05091 
05092 
05093   case IS_DIAG:
05094 
05095     for (i=1; i <= a[0][NR]; ++i) {
05096       c[i][i] = a[i][i];
05097     }
05098 
05099     break;
05100 
05101 
05102   default:
05103 
05104     exit(-19);
05105 
05106   }
05107 
05108   return TRUE;
05109 
05110 }

05113 /*!*****************************************************************************
05114  *******************************************************************************
05115  \note  mat_equal_size
05116  \date  August 17, 92
05117  
05118  \remarks 
05119  
05120  set matrix c = a
05121  matrix indices start at "1".
05122  Note: if a vector is passed, it must be the pointer to the vector;
05123  everything is handled as a matrix!
05124  
05125  *******************************************************************************
05126  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
05127  
05128  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
05129  \param[in]     nr              : number of rows of a
05130  \param[in]     nc              : number of columns of a
05131  \param[out]    c                : result of addition
05132  
05133  ******************************************************************************/
05134 int
05135 mat_equal_size(Matrix a, int nr, int nc, Matrix c)
05136 
05137 {
05138   int i,j;
05139 
05140   for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
05141     for (j=1; j <= nc; ++j){
05142       c[i][j] = a[i][j];
05143     }
05144   }
05145 
05146   return TRUE;
05147 
05148 }

05151 /*!*****************************************************************************
05152  *******************************************************************************
05153  \note  vec_add
05154  \date  August 17, 92
05155  
05156  \remarks 
05157  
05158  adds two arbitrary (compatible) vectors a + b, assuming the
05159  vector indices start at "1".
05160  
05161  *******************************************************************************
05162  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
05163  
05164  \param[in]     a                : vector a
05165  \param[in]     b                : vector b
05166  \param[out]    c                : result of addition
05167  
05168  ******************************************************************************/
05169 int
05170 vec_add(Vector a, Vector b, Vector c)
05171 {
05172 
05173   int     i;
05174   
05175   if (a[NR] != b[NR] || a[NR] != c[NR]) {
05176     printf("Incompatible vectors in vec_add\n");
05177     return FALSE;
05178   }
05179 
05180   for (i=1; i <= a[NR]; ++i) {
05181     c[i] = a[i] + b[i];
05182   }
05183 
05184   return TRUE;
05185 
05186 }
05187 
05188 /*!*****************************************************************************
05189  *******************************************************************************
05190  \note  vec_add_size
05191  \date  August 17, 92
05192  
05193  \remarks 
05194  
05195  adds two arbitrary (compatible) vectors a + b, assuming the
05196  vector indices start at "1".
05197  
05198  *******************************************************************************
05199  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
05200  
05201  \param[in]     a                : vector a
05202  \param[in]     b                : vector b
05203  \param[in]     nr              : number of elements in vector
05204  \param[out]    c                : result of addition
05205  
05206  ******************************************************************************/
05207 int
05208 vec_add_size(Vector a, Vector b, int nr, Vector c)
05209 {
05210 
05211   int     i;
05212   
05213   for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
05214     c[i] = a[i] + b[i];
05215   }
05216 
05217   return TRUE;
05218 
05219 }

05229

05235  \param[out]    c                : result of addition
05236

05238 int
05239 vec_add_scalar(Vector a, double scalar, Vector c)
05240 {
05241

05243   
05244   if (a[NR] != c[NR]) {
05245     printf("Incompatible vectors in vec_add_scalar\n");
05246     return FALSE;
05247   }
05248 
05249   for (i=1; i <= a[NR]; ++i) {
05250     c[i] = a[i] + scalar;
05251   }
05252 
05253   return TRUE;

05257 /*!*****************************************************************************

05260  \date  August 17, 92
05261  
05262  \remarks 
05263  
05264  subtracts two arbitrary (compatible) vectors a - b, assuming the
05265  vector indices start at "1".
05266  
05267  *******************************************************************************
05268  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
05269  
05270  \param[in]     a                : vector a
05271  \param[in]     b                : vector b
05272  \param[out]    c                : result of addition
05273  
05274  ******************************************************************************/
05275 int
05276 vec_sub(Vector a, Vector b, Vector c)
05277 {
05278 
05279   int     i;
05280   
05281   if (a[NR] != b[NR] || a[NR] != c[NR]) {
05282     printf("Incompatible vectors in vec_sub\n");
05283     return FALSE;
05284   }
05285 
05286   for (i=1; i <= a[NR]; ++i) {
05287     c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
05288   }
05289 
05290   return TRUE;
05291

05294 /*!*****************************************************************************
05295  *******************************************************************************
05296  \note  vec_euc2
05297  \date  May 1998
05298  
05299  \remarks 
05300  
05301  returns the squared euclidan norm of two vectors
05302  
05303  *******************************************************************************
05304  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
05305  
05306  \param[in]     a                : vector a
05307  \param[in]     b                : vector b
05308  
05309  ******************************************************************************/
05310 double 
05311 vec_euc2(Vector a, Vector b)
05312 {
05313 
05314   int     i;
05315   double  euc2=0;
05316   
05317   if (a[NR] != b[NR]) {
05318     printf("Incompatible vectors in vec_euc2\n");
05319     return FALSE;
05320   }
05321 
05322   for (i=1; i <= a[NR]; ++i) {
05323     euc2 += sqr(a[i] - b[i]);
05324   }
05325 
05326   return euc2;
05327 
05328 }
05329 
05330 /*!*****************************************************************************
05331  *******************************************************************************
05332  \note  vec_euc2_size
05333  \date  May 1998
05334  
05335  \remarks 
05336  
05337  returns builds the squared euclidian norm between two equal size vectors
05338  
05339  *******************************************************************************
05340  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
05341  
05342  \param[in]     a                : vector a
05343  \param[in]     b                : vector b
05344  \param[in]     nr              : length of vector
05345  
05346  ******************************************************************************/
05347 double
05348 vec_euc2_size(Vector a, Vector b, int nr)
05349 {
05350 
05351   int     i;
05352   double euc2=0;
05353   
05354   for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
05355     euc2 += sqr(a[i] - b[i]);
05356   }
05357 
05358   return euc2;
05359 
05360 }

05362 /*!*****************************************************************************
05363  *******************************************************************************
05364  \note  vec_sub_size
05365  \date  August 17, 92
05366  
05367  \remarks 
05368  
05369  subtracts two arbitrary (compatible) vectors a + b, assuming the
05370  vector indices start at "1".
05371  
05372  *******************************************************************************
05373  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
05374  
05375  \param[in]     a                : vector a
05376  \param[in]     b                : vector b
05377  \param[in]     nr              : length of vector
05378  \param[out]    c                : result of addition
05379  
05380  ******************************************************************************/
05381 int
05382 vec_sub_size(Vector a, Vector b, int nr, Vector c)
05383 {
05384 
05385   int     i;
05386   
05387   for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
05388     c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
05389   }
05390 
05391   return TRUE;
05392 
05393 }
05394 
05395 /*!*****************************************************************************
05396  *******************************************************************************
05397  \note  mat_trans
05398  \date  August 17, 92
05399  
05400  \remarks 
05401  
05402  builds the transpose of a matrix
05403  Note: if a vector is passed, it must be the pointer to the vector;
05404  everything is handled as a matrix!
05405  
05406  *******************************************************************************
05407  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
05408  
05409  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
05410  \param[out]    c                : result of transpose
05411  
05412  ******************************************************************************/
05413 int
05414 mat_trans(Matrix a, Matrix c)
05415 
05416 {
05417   int    i,j;
05418   Matrix temp;
05419   int    nr,nc;
05420 
05421   if (c[0][MAT_TYPE] > a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
05422     printf("Incompatible matrix types in mat_trans\n");
05423     return FALSE;
05424   }
05425 
05426   if (a[0][NR] != c[0][NC] || a[0][NC] != c[0][NR]) {
05427     printf("Incompatible matrices in mat_trans\n");
05428     return FALSE;
05429   }
05430 
05431   nc = a[0][NC];
05432   nr = a[0][NR];
05433 
05434   switch ((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
05435 
05436   case IS_FULL:
05437 
05438     if (a == c) {
05439       temp = my_matrix(1,nc,1,nr);
05440     } else {
05441       temp = c;
05442     } 
05443 
05444     for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
05445       for (j=1; j <= nc; ++j){
05446         temp[j][i] = a[i][j];
05447       }
05448     }
05449 
05450     if (a == c) {
05451       mat_equal(temp,c);
05452       my_free_matrix(temp,1,nc,1,nr);
05453     }
05454 
05455     break;
05456 
05457 
05458   case IS_DIAG:
05459 
05460     mat_equal(a,c);
05461 
05462     break;
05463 
05464 
05465   case IS_SYMM:
05466 
05467     mat_equal(a,c);
05468 
05469     break;
05470 
05471 
05472   default:
05473 
05474     exit(-20);
05475 
05476   }
05477 
05478   return TRUE;
05479 
05480 }
05481 
05482 /*!*****************************************************************************
05483  *******************************************************************************
05484  \note  mat_trans_size
05485  \date  August 17, 92
05486  
05487  \remarks 
05488  
05489  builds the transpose of a matrix
05490  Note: if a vector is passed, it must be the pointer to the vector;
05491  everything is handled as a matrix!
05492  
05493  *******************************************************************************
05494  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
05495  
05496  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
05497  \param[in]     nr              : number of rows of a
05498  \param[in]     nc              : number of columns of a
05499  \param[out]    c                : result of transpose
05500  
05501  ******************************************************************************/
05502 int
05503 mat_trans_size(Matrix a, int nr, int nc, Matrix c)
05504 
05505 {
05506   int    i,j;
05507   Matrix temp;
05508 
05509   if (a == c) {
05510     temp = my_matrix(1,nc,1,nr);
05511   } else {
05512     temp = c;
05513   }
05514   
05515   for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
05516     for (j=1; j <= nc; ++j){
05517       temp[j][i] = a[i][j];
05518     }
05519   }
05520   
05521   if (a == c) {
05522     mat_equal(temp,c);
05523     my_free_matrix(temp,1,nc,1,nr);
05524   }
05525 
05526   return TRUE;
05527 
05528 }
05529 
05530 /*!*****************************************************************************
05531  *******************************************************************************
05532  \note  mat_mult_inner
05533  \date  January 94
05534  Rewritten      : July 18, 2002 (adsouza)
05535  
05536  \remarks 
05537  
05538  multiplies the transpose of the matrix with the matrix: a' * a
05539 
05540  *******************************************************************************
05541  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
05542 
05543  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
05544  \param[out]    c                : result of operation
05545 
05546  ******************************************************************************/
05547 int
05548 mat_mult_inner(Matrix a, Matrix c){
05549   int    i,j,k;
05550   Matrix temp;
05551   int    ar,ac,cr,cc;
05552 
05553   ar = a[0][NR];
05554   ac = a[0][NC];
05555   cr = c[0][NR];
05556   cc = c[0][NC];
05557   
05558   if (cr!=ac || cc!=ac) {
05559     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible matrix sizes in >mat_mult_inner<\n");
05560     return FALSE;
05561   }
05562   if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG && a[0][MAT_TYPE]!=IS_DIAG){
05563     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible output matrix type in >mat_mult_inner<\n");
05564     return FALSE;
05565   }
05566   
05567   /* check whether input and output matrices are different */
05568   if (a == c) {
05569     if (c[0][MAT_TYPE] == IS_SYMM)
05570       temp = my_matrix_symm(1,cr,1,cc);
05571     else if (c[0][MAT_TYPE] == IS_DIAG)
05572       temp = my_matrix_diag(1,cr,1,cc);
05573     else 
05574       temp = my_matrix(1,cr,1,cc);
05575   } else {
05576     temp = c;
05577   }
05578 
05579   switch((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]){
05580   case IS_FULL:
05581     for(i=1; i<=cr; i++)
05582       for(j=i; j<=cc; j++){
05583         temp[i][j] = 0.0;
05584         for(k=1; k<=ar; k++)
05585           temp[i][j] += a[k][i]*a[k][j];
05586       }
05587 
05588     if(temp[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
05589       for(i=1; i<=cr; i++)
05590         for(j=i+1; j<=cc; j++)
05591           temp[j][i] = temp[i][j];
05592     break;
05593 
05594   case IS_SYMM:
05595     for (i=1; i<=cr; i++)
05596       for (j=i; j<=cc; j++){
05597         temp[i][j]=0.0;
05598         for (k=1; k<=ar; k++){
05599           if(i<=k && k<=j)
05600             temp[i][j] += a[i][k]*a[k][j];
05601           else if(i>k && k<=j)
05602             temp[i][j] += a[k][i]*a[k][j];
05603           else if(i<=k && k>j)
05604             temp[i][j] += a[i][k]*a[j][k];
05605           else
05606             temp[i][j] += a[k][i]*a[j][k];
05607         }
05608       }
05609 
05610     if(temp[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
05611       for(i=1; i<=cr; i++)
05612         for(j=i+1; j<=cc; j++)
05613           temp[j][i] = temp[i][j];
05614     break;
05615 
05616   case IS_DIAG:
05617     mat_zero(temp);
05618     for(i=1; i<=cr; i++)
05619       temp[i][i] = a[i][i]*a[i][i];
05620     break;
05621 
05622   default:
05623     fprintf(stderr, "ABORT: Unrecognized matrix type in >mat_mult_inner<\n");
05624     exit(-12);
05625   }
05626 
05627   if(a==c){
05628     mat_equal(temp,c);
05629     my_free_matrix(temp,1,cr,1,cc);
05630   }
05631 
05632   return TRUE;
05633 }
05634 
05635 /*!*****************************************************************************
05636  *******************************************************************************
05637 \note  mat_mult_outer
05638 \date  January 94
05639 Rewritten       : July 18, 2002 (adsouza)
05640 
05641 \remarks 
05642 
05643         multiplies the matrix with its transpose: a * a'
05644         
05645  *******************************************************************************
05646         Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
05647         
05648  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
05649  \param[out]    c                : result of operation
05650         
05651  ******************************************************************************/
05652 int
05653 mat_mult_outer(Matrix a, Matrix c){
05654   int    i,j,k;
05655   Matrix temp;
05656   int    ar,ac,cr,cc;
05657 
05658   ar = a[0][NR];
05659   ac = a[0][NC];
05660   cr = c[0][NR];
05661   cc = c[0][NC];
05662   
05663   if (cr!=ar || cc!=ar) {
05664     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible matrix sizes in >mat_mult_inner<\n");
05665     return FALSE;
05666   }
05667   if(c[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_DIAG && a[0][MAT_TYPE]!=IS_DIAG){
05668     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Incompatible output matrix type in >mat_mult_inner<\n");
05669     return FALSE;
05670   }
05671   
05672   /* check whether input and output matrices are different */
05673   if (a == c) {
05674     if (c[0][MAT_TYPE] == IS_SYMM)
05675       temp = my_matrix_symm(1,cr,1,cc);
05676     else if (c[0][MAT_TYPE] == IS_DIAG)
05677       temp = my_matrix_diag(1,cr,1,cc);
05678     else 
05679       temp = my_matrix(1,cr,1,cc);
05680   } else {
05681     temp = c;
05682   }
05683 
05684   switch((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]){
05685   case IS_FULL:
05686     for(i=1; i<=cr; i++)
05687       for(j=i; j<=cc; j++){
05688         temp[i][j] = 0.0;
05689         for(k=1; k<=ac; k++)
05690           temp[i][j] += a[i][k]*a[j][k];
05691       }
05692 
05693     if(temp[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
05694       for(i=1; i<=cr; i++)
05695         for(j=i+1; j<=cc; j++)
05696           temp[j][i] = temp[i][j];
05697     break;
05698 
05699   case IS_SYMM:
05700     for (i=1; i<=cr; i++)
05701       for (j=i; j<=cc; j++){
05702         temp[i][j]=0.0;
05703         for (k=1; k<=ac; k++){
05704           if(i<=k && k<=j)
05705             temp[i][j] += a[i][k]*a[k][j];
05706           else if(i>k && k<=j)
05707             temp[i][j] += a[k][i]*a[k][j];
05708           else if(i<=k && k>j)
05709             temp[i][j] += a[i][k]*a[j][k];
05710           else
05711             temp[i][j] += a[k][i]*a[j][k];
05712         }
05713       }
05714 
05715     if(temp[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
05716       for(i=1; i<=cr; i++)
05717         for(j=i+1; j<=cc; j++)
05718           temp[j][i] = temp[i][j];
05719     break;
05720 
05721   case IS_DIAG:
05722     mat_zero(temp);
05723     for(i=1; i<=cr; i++)
05724       temp[i][i] = a[i][i]*a[i][i];
05725     break;
05726 
05727   default:
05728     fprintf(stderr, "ABORT: Unrecognized matrix type in >mat_mult_inner<\n");
05729     exit(-12);
05730   }
05731 
05732   if(a==c){
05733     mat_equal(temp,c);
05734     my_free_matrix(temp,1,cr,1,cc);
05735   }
05736 
05737   return TRUE;
05738 }
05739 
05740 /*!*****************************************************************************
05741  *******************************************************************************
05742 \note  mat_mult_outer_size
05743 \date  January 94
05744 
05745 \remarks 
05746 
05747         multiplies the matrix with its transpose: a * a'
05748         
05749  *******************************************************************************
05750         Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
05751         
05752  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
05753  \param[in]     nr               : number of rows of a
05754  \param[in]     nc               : number of colums of a
05755  \param[out]    c                : result of operation
05756         
05757  ******************************************************************************/
05758 int
05759 mat_mult_outer_size(Matrix a, int nr, int nc, Matrix c)
05760 
05761 {
05762   int    i,j,m;
05763   Matrix temp;
05764 
05765   /* check whether input and output matrices are different */
05766   
05767   if (a == c) {
05768     temp = my_matrix(1,nr,1,nr);
05769   } else {
05770     temp = c;
05771   }
05772 
05773 
05774   for (i=1; i <= nr; ++i) {
05775     for (j=1; j <= nr; ++j){
05776       temp[i][j] = 0.0;
05777       for (m=1; m <= nc; ++m) {
05778         temp[i][j] += a[i][m] * a[j][m];
05779       }
05780     }
05781   }
05782 
05783   if ( a == c) {
05784     mat_equal_size(temp,nr,nr,c);
05785     my_free_matrix(temp,1,nr,1,nr);
05786   }
05787 
05788   return TRUE;
05789 
05790 }
05791 
05792 
05793 /*****************************************************************************
05794   utility program vector: allocates a double vector with range nl...nh
05795   ****************************************************************************/
05796 Vector
05797 my_vector(int nl, int nh)
05798 
05799 {
05800   double *v;
05801 
05802   if (nl == 1) {
05803     
05804     v = (double *) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nh-nl+1+1),sizeof(double));
05805     if (v==NULL)
05806       printf("allocation failure in vector()");
05807     v[0] = nh-nl+1;
05808     return v;
05809 
05810   } else {
05811 
05812     v = (double *) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nh-nl+1),sizeof(double));
05813     if (v==NULL)
05814       printf("allocation failure in vector()");
05815     return v-nl;
05816 
05817   }
05818 
05819 }
05820 
05821 void 
05822 my_free_vector(Vector vec, int nl, int nh)
05823 {
05824   if (nl == 1) {
05825     free((char*) (vec));
05826   } else {
05827     free((char*) (vec+nl));
05828   }
05829 }
05830 
05831 /***************************************************************************
05832   utility program vector: allocates a float vector with range nl...nh
05833   **************************************************************************/
05834 fVector
05835 my_fvector(int nl, int nh)
05836 {
05837 
05838   float *v;
05839 
05840   if (nl == 1) {
05841     
05842     v = (float *) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nh-nl+1+1),sizeof(float));
05843     if (v==NULL)
05844       printf("allocation failure in vector()");
05845     v[0] = nh-nl+1;
05846     return v;
05847 
05848   } else {
05849 
05850     v = (float *) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nh-nl+1),sizeof(float));
05851     if (v==NULL)
05852       printf("allocation failure in vector()");
05853     return v-nl;
05854 
05855   }
05856 
05857 }
05858 
05859 void 
05860 my_free_fvector(fVector vec, int nl, int nh)
05861 {
05862   if (nl == 1) {
05863     free((char*) (vec));
05864   } else {
05865     free((char*) (vec+nl));
05866   }
05867 }

05872 iVector
05873 my_ivector(int nl, int nh)
05874 {
05875   int *v;
05876 
05877   if (nl == 1) {
05878     
05879     v = (int *) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nh-nl+1+1),sizeof(int));
05880     if (v==NULL)
05881       printf("allocation failure in vector()");
05882     v[0] = nh-nl+1;
05883     return v;
05884 
05885   } else {
05886 
05887     v = (int *) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nh-nl+1),sizeof(int));
05888     if (v==NULL)
05889       printf("allocation failure in vector()");
05890     return v-nl;
05891 
05892   }
05893 
05894 }

05942 
05943 /*****************************************************************************
05944   utility program my_nrerror
05945   ****************************************************************************/
05946 void 
05947 my_nrerror(char *error_text)
05948 {
05949   fprintf(stderr,"Numerical Recipes run-time error...\n");
05950   fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",error_text);
05951   fprintf(stderr,"...now exiting to system...\n");
05952   fprintf(stderr,"\n        hit return to continue...\n");
05953   getchar();
05954   exit(-1);
05955 }
05956 
05957 /******************************************************************************
05958   utility program my_matrix: note: this is a modified version of
05959   the normal matrix() numerical recipe version. It allocates
05960   the memory for the matrix in one chunk, such that it can
05961   be treated as consecutive memory in write() or DSP programs
05962   
05963  *****************************************************************************/
05964 Matrix
05965 my_matrix(int nrl, int nrh, int ncl, int nch)
05966 {
05967 
05968   int      i;
05969   double **m;
05970   double  *chunk;
05971   int      info = FALSE;
05972 
05973   if (nrl==1 && ncl == 1) {
05974     info = TRUE;
05975   }
05976 
05977   m    = (double **) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nrh-nrl+1+info),sizeof(double*));
05978   if (m==NULL)
05979     my_nrerror("allocation failure 1 in matrix()");
05980 
05981   if (info) {
05982 
05983     m[0] = (double *) my_calloc_track((size_t) N_MAT_INFO,sizeof(double));
05984     if (m[0]==NULL)
05985       my_nrerror("allocation failure 0 in matrix()");
05986     m[0][MAT_TYPE] = IS_FULL;
05987     m[0][NR]       = nrh-nrl+1;
05988     m[0][NC]       = nch-ncl+1;
05989 
05990   } else {
05991   
05992     m -= nrl;
05993 
05994   }
05995     
05996   chunk = (double *) my_calloc_track( (size_t) (nrh-nrl+1) * (nch-ncl+1),sizeof(double));
05997   if (chunk==NULL)
05998     my_nrerror("allocation failure 2 in matrix()");
05999   
06000   for(i=nrl;i<=nrh;i++) {
06001     m[i]=(double *) &(chunk[(i-nrl)*(nch-ncl+1)]);
06002     m[i] -= ncl;
06003   }
06004   
06005   return m;
06006   
06007 }
06008 
06009 
06010 /*****************************************************************************
06011   my_matrix_sym; allocates the memory for a symmetric matrix, i.e., the
06012   upper diagonal matrix including the diagonal.Can be freed with my_free_matrix
06013   ***************************************************************************/
06014 Matrix
06015 my_matrix_symm(int nrl, int nrh, int ncl, int nch)
06016 {
06017 
06018   int      i,j;
06019   double **m;
06020   double  *chunk;
06021   int      info = FALSE;
06022   
06023   if (nrh-nrl != nch-ncl)
06024     my_nrerror("diagonal matrices must be square!\n");
06025 
06026   if (nrl==1 && ncl == 1) {
06027     info = TRUE;
06028   }
06029 
06030   m    = (double **) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nrh-nrl+1+info),sizeof(double*));
06031   if (m==NULL)
06032     my_nrerror("allocation failure 1 in matrix()");
06033 
06034   if (info) {
06035 
06036     m[0] = (double *) my_calloc_track((size_t) N_MAT_INFO,sizeof(double));
06037     if (m[0]==NULL)
06038       my_nrerror("allocation failure 0 in matrix()");
06039     m[0][MAT_TYPE] = IS_SYMM;
06040     m[0][NR]       = nrh-nrl+1;
06041     m[0][NC]       = nch-ncl+1;
06042 
06043   } else {
06044   
06045     m -= nrl;
06046 
06047   }
06048 
06049   chunk = (double *)my_calloc_track((size_t)(sqr(nrh-nrl+1) + (nrh-nrl+1))/2.,sizeof(double));
06050   if (chunk==NULL)
06051     my_nrerror("allocation failure 2 in matrix()");
06052   
06053   j = 0;
06054   
06055   for(i=nrl;i<=nrh;i++) {
06056     m[i]=(double *) &(chunk[j]);
06057     m[i] -= ncl + (i-nrl);
06058     j = j + (nch-ncl+1) - (i-nrl);
06059   }
06060   
06061   return m;
06062 
06063 }
06064 /*****************************************************************************
06065   my_imatrix_sym; allocates the memory for a symmetric matrix, i.e., the
06066   upper diagonal matrix including the diagonal.Can be freed with my_free_imatrix
06067   ***************************************************************************/
06068 iMatrix
06069 my_imatrix_symm(int nrl, int nrh, int ncl, int nch)
06070 {
06071 
06072   int      i,j;
06073   int    **m;
06074   int     *chunk;
06075   int      info = FALSE;
06076   
06077   if (nrh-nrl != nch-ncl)
06078     my_nrerror("diagonal matrices must be square!\n");
06079 
06080   if (nrl==1 && ncl == 1) {
06081     info = TRUE;
06082   }
06083 
06084   m    = (int **) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nrh-nrl+1+info),sizeof(int*));
06085   if (m==NULL)
06086     my_nrerror("allocation failure 1 in imatrix()");
06087 
06088   if (info) {
06089 
06090     m[0] = (int *) my_calloc_track((size_t) N_MAT_INFO,sizeof(int));
06091     if (m[0]==NULL)
06092       my_nrerror("allocation failure 0 in imatrix()");
06093     m[0][MAT_TYPE] = IS_SYMM;
06094     m[0][NR]       = nrh-nrl+1;
06095     m[0][NC]       = nch-ncl+1;
06096 
06097   } else {
06098   
06099     m -= nrl;
06100 
06101   }
06102 
06103   chunk = (int *)my_calloc_track((size_t)(sqr(nrh-nrl+1) + (nrh-nrl+1))/2.,sizeof(int));
06104   if (chunk==NULL)
06105     my_nrerror("allocation failure 2 in imatrix()");
06106   
06107   j = 0;
06108   
06109   for(i=nrl;i<=nrh;i++) {
06110     m[i]=(int *) &(chunk[j]);
06111     m[i] -= ncl + (i-nrl);
06112     j = j + (nch-ncl+1) - (i-nrl);
06113   }
06114   
06115   return m;
06116 
06117 }
06118 /******************************************************************************
06119   my_matrix_diag; allocates the memory for a diagonal matrix, i.e., 
06120   only the diagonal. Can be freed with my_free_matrix
06121   ****************************************************************************/
06122 Matrix
06123 my_matrix_diag(int nrl, int nrh, int ncl, int nch)
06124 
06125 {
06126   int      i,j;
06127   double **m;
06128   double  *chunk;
06129   int      info = FALSE;
06130   
06131   if (nrh-nrl != nch-ncl)
06132     my_nrerror("diagonal matrices must be square!\n");
06133 
06134   if (nrl==1 && ncl == 1) {
06135     info = TRUE;
06136   }
06137 
06138   m    = (double **) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nrh-nrl+1+info),sizeof(double*));
06139   if (m==NULL)
06140     my_nrerror("allocation failure 1 in matrix()");
06141 
06142   if (info) {
06143 
06144     m[0] = (double *) my_calloc_track((size_t) N_MAT_INFO,sizeof(double));
06145     if (m[0]==NULL)
06146       my_nrerror("allocation failure 0 in matrix()");
06147     m[0][MAT_TYPE] = IS_DIAG;
06148     m[0][NR]       = nrh-nrl+1;
06149     m[0][NC]       = nch-ncl+1;
06150 
06151   } else {
06152   
06153     m -= nrl;
06154 
06155   }
06156   
06157   chunk = (double *) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nrh-nrl+1),sizeof(double));
06158   if (chunk==NULL)
06159     my_nrerror("allocation failure 2 in matrix()");
06160   
06161   j = 0;
06162   
06163   for(i=nrl;i<=nrh;i++) {
06164     m[i]=(double *) &(chunk[j]);
06165     m[i] -= ncl + (i-nrl);
06166     j = j + 1;
06167   }
06168   
06169   return m;
06170 
06171 }
06172 
06173 
06174 /******************************************************************************
06175   my_imatrix_diag; allocates the memory for a diagonal matrix, i.e., 
06176   only the diagonal. Can be freed with my_free_imatrix
06177   ****************************************************************************/
06178 iMatrix
06179 my_imatrix_diag(int nrl, int nrh, int ncl, int nch)
06180 
06181 {
06182   int      i,j;
06183   int **m;
06184   int  *chunk;
06185   int      info = FALSE;
06186   
06187   if (nrh-nrl != nch-ncl)
06188     my_nrerror("diagonal matrices must be square!\n");
06189 
06190   if (nrl==1 && ncl == 1) {
06191     info = TRUE;
06192   }
06193 
06194   m    = (int **) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nrh-nrl+1+info),sizeof(int*));
06195   if (m==NULL)
06196     my_nrerror("allocation failure 1 in matrix()");
06197 
06198   if (info) {
06199 
06200     m[0] = (int *) my_calloc_track((size_t) N_MAT_INFO,sizeof(int));
06201     if (m[0]==NULL)
06202       my_nrerror("allocation failure 0 in matrix()");
06203     m[0][MAT_TYPE] = IS_DIAG;
06204     m[0][NR]       = nrh-nrl+1;
06205     m[0][NC]       = nch-ncl+1;
06206 
06207   } else {
06208   
06209     m -= nrl;
06210 
06211   }
06212   
06213   chunk = (int *) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nrh-nrl+1),sizeof(int));
06214   if (chunk==NULL)
06215     my_nrerror("allocation failure 2 in matrix()");
06216   
06217   j = 0;
06218   
06219   for(i=nrl;i<=nrh;i++) {
06220     m[i]=(int *) &(chunk[j]);
06221     m[i] -= ncl + (i-nrl);
06222     j = j + 1;
06223   }
06224   
06225   return m;
06226 
06227 }
