06229 
06230 /*****************************************************************************
06231   utility program my_free_matrix; adjusted to my special matrix() program
06232   ***************************************************************************/
06233 void 
06234 my_free_matrix(Matrix mat, int nrl, int nrh, int ncl, int nch)
06235 
06236 {
06237   int i;
06238 
06239   free((char*) &(mat[nrl][ncl]));
06240   if (nrl==1 && ncl==1) {
06241     free((char*) mat[0]);
06242     free((char*) mat);
06243   } else {
06244     free((char*) (mat+nrl));
06245   }
06246 
06247 }
06248 
06249 /******************************************************************************
06250   utility program my_matrix: note: this is a modified version of
06251   the normal matrix() numerical recipe version. It allocates
06252   the memory for the matrix in one chunk, such that it can
06253   be treated as consecutive memory in write() or DSP programs
06254   ****************************************************************************/
06255 fMatrix
06256 my_fmatrix(int nrl, int nrh, int ncl, int nch)
06257 {
06258 
06259   int      i;
06260   float **m;
06261   float  *chunk;
06262   int      info = FALSE;
06263 
06264   if (nrl==1 && ncl == 1) {
06265     info = TRUE;
06266   }
06267 
06268   m    = (float **) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nrh-nrl+1+info),sizeof(float*));
06269   if (m==NULL)
06270     my_nrerror("allocation failure 1 in matrix()");
06271 
06272   if (info) {
06273 
06274     m[0] = (float *) my_calloc_track((size_t) N_MAT_INFO,sizeof(float));
06275     if (m[0]==NULL)
06276       my_nrerror("allocation failure 0 in matrix()");
06277     m[0][MAT_TYPE] = IS_FULL;
06278     m[0][NR]       = nrh-nrl+1;
06279     m[0][NC]       = nch-ncl+1;
06280 
06281   } else {
06282   
06283     m -= nrl;
06284 
06285   }
06286     
06287   chunk = (float *) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nrh-nrl+1) * (nch-ncl+1),sizeof(float));
06288   if (chunk==NULL)
06289     my_nrerror("allocation failure 2 in matrix()");
06290   
06291   for(i=nrl;i<=nrh;i++) {
06292     m[i]=(float *) &(chunk[(i-nrl)*(nch-ncl+1)]);
06293     m[i] -= ncl;
06294   }
06295   
06296   return m;
06297 
06298 }
06299 
06300 /******************************************************************************
06301   utility program my_free_fmatrix; adjusted to my special matrix() program
06302   ****************************************************************************/
06303 void 
06304 my_free_fmatrix(fMatrix mat, int nrl, int nrh, int ncl, int nch)
06305 
06306 {
06307   int i;
06308 
06309   free((char*) &(mat[nrl][ncl]));
06310   if (nrl==1 && ncl==1) {
06311     free((char*) mat[0]);
06312     free((char*) mat);
06313   } else {
06314     free((char*) (mat+nrl));
06315   }
06316 
06317 }
06318 /******************************************************************************
06319   utility program my_imatrix: note: this is a modified version of
06320   the normal matrix() numerical recipe version. It allocates
06321   the memory for the matrix in one chunk, such that it can
06322   be treated as consecutive memory in write() or DSP programs
06323   ****************************************************************************/
06324 iMatrix
06325 my_imatrix(int nrl, int nrh, int ncl, int nch)
06326 
06327 {
06328 
06329   int      i;
06330   int    **m;
06331   int     *chunk;
06332   int      info = FALSE;
06333 
06334   if (nrl==1 && ncl == 1) {
06335     info = TRUE;
06336   }
06337 
06338   m    = (int **) my_calloc_track((size_t) (nrh-nrl+1+info),sizeof(int*));
06339   if (m==NULL)
06340     my_nrerror("allocation failure 1 in matrix()");
06341 
06342   if (info) {
06343 
06344     m[0] = (int *) my_calloc_track((size_t) N_MAT_INFO,sizeof(int));
06345     if (m[0]==NULL)
06346       my_nrerror("allocation failure 0 in matrix()");
06347     m[0][MAT_TYPE] = IS_FULL;
06348     m[0][NR]       = nrh-nrl+1;
06349     m[0][NC]       = nch-ncl+1;
06350 
06351   } else {
06352   
06353     m -= nrl;
06354 
06355   }
06356     
06357   chunk = (int *) my_calloc_track( (size_t) (nrh-nrl+1) * (nch-ncl+1),sizeof(int));
06358   if (chunk==NULL)
06359     my_nrerror("allocation failure 2 in matrix()");
06360   
06361   for(i=nrl;i<=nrh;i++) {
06362     m[i]=(int *) &(chunk[(i-nrl)*(nch-ncl+1)]);
06363     m[i] -= ncl;
06364   }
06365   
06366   return m;
06367 
06368 }
06369 
06370 /******************************************************************************
06371   utility program my_free_fmatrix; adjusted to my special matrix() program
06372   ****************************************************************************/
06373 void 
06374 my_free_imatrix(iMatrix mat, int nrl, int nrh, int ncl, int nch)
06375 
06376 {
06377   int i;
06378 
06379   free((char*) &(mat[nrl][ncl]));
06380   if (nrl==1 && ncl==1) {
06381     free((char*) mat[0]);
06382     free((char*) mat);
06383   } else {
06384     free((char*) (mat+nrl));
06385   }
06386

06389 /*!*****************************************************************************
06390  *******************************************************************************
06391  \note  my_ran0
06392  \date  11/10/91
06393  
06394  \remarks 
06395  
06396  this is the numerical recipes function to smoothen the problems with
06397  the C-function rand()
06398  
06399  *******************************************************************************
06400  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
06401  
06402  \param[in]     seed            : used for seeding rand() when function is called the first
06403  time, or when seed < 0!
06404  
06405  note: the returned number is between 0.0 and 1.0
06406  
06407  ******************************************************************************/
06408 double
06409 my_ran0(int *idum)
06410      
06411 {
06412 
06413   static double y, maxran, v[98];
06414   double dum;
06415   static int iff=0;
06416   int j;
06417   unsigned i,k;
06418   void my_nrerror();
06419 
06420 
06421   if (*idum < 0 || iff == 0) {
06422 
06423     iff = 1;
06424     maxran = MY_RAND_MAX+1.0;
06425     srand(*idum);
06426     *idum = 1;
06427     for (j=1; j<=97; j++)
06428       dum = rand()%MY_RAND_MAX;
06429     for (j=1; j<=97; j++)
06430       v[j] = rand()%MY_RAND_MAX; /* ensure sun-compatib. */
06431     y = rand()%MY_RAND_MAX;
06432 
06433   }
06434 
06435   j = 1. + 97.0 * y/maxran;
06436 
06437   if (j > 97 || j < 1)
06438     my_nrerror("my_ran0: This is nonsense\n");
06439   y = v[j];
06440   v[j] = rand()%MY_RAND_MAX;
06441 
06442   return (y/maxran);
06443 }
06444 
06445 /*!*****************************************************************************
06446  *******************************************************************************
06447  \note  my_gasdev
06448  \date  11/10/91
06449  
06450  \remarks 
06451  
06452  this is the numerical recipes function which returns a normally
06453  distributed deviate with zero mean and unit variance, using my_ran0
06454  
06455  *******************************************************************************
06456  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
06457  
06458  \param[in]     seed            : used for seeding rand() when function is called the first
06459  time, or when seed < 0!
06460  
06461  
06462  ******************************************************************************/
06463 double
06464 my_gasdev(int *idum)
06465      
06466 {
06467 
06468   static int iset=0;
06469   static double gset;
06470   double fac, r, v1, v2;
06471 
06472   if (iset == 0) {
06473 
06474     do {
06475       v1 = 2.0 * my_ran0(idum) - 1.0;
06476       v2 = 2.0 * my_ran0(idum) - 1.0;
06477       r = sqr(v1) + sqr(v2);
06478     }
06479     while (r >= 1.0);
06480 
06481     fac = sqrt(-2.0 * log(r)/r);
06482     gset = v1 * fac;
06483     iset = 1;
06484     return v2*fac;
06485 
06486   }
06487   else {
06488 
06489     iset = 0;
06490     return gset;
06491 
06492   }
06493 }
06494 
06495 /*!*****************************************************************************
06496  *******************************************************************************
06497  \note  read_a_float
06498  \date  11/10/93
06499  
06500  \remarks 
06501  
06502  read a float type variabe with a comment in front; this important
06503  for checking parameter readings in long parameter lists
06504  
06505  *******************************************************************************
06506  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
06507  
06508  \param[in]     silent   : don't print message
06509  \param[in]     fd       : pointer to file where line should be read
06510  \param[in]     string   : string to be printed with read variable
06511  \param[out]    pvalue   : pointer to variable to be returned
06512 
06513  ******************************************************************************/
06514 void
06515 read_a_float(int silent, FILE *fd, char *string, float *pvalue )
06516 
06517 {
06518   float value;
06519   char scanf_string1[ 1000 ];
06520   char scanf_string2[ 1000 ];
06521   int rc;
06522 
06523   rc = fscanf( fd, "%s %s %f", scanf_string1, scanf_string2, &value );
06524   *pvalue = (float) value;
06525   if (!silent)  
06526     printf( "reading %s: %s %s %g\n", string, scanf_string1, scanf_string2,
06527            *pvalue );
06528 }
06529

06670 /*!*****************************************************************************
06671  *******************************************************************************
06672  \note  fopen_strip
06673  \date  March 94
06674  
06675  \remarks 
06676  
06677  opens a file with a given file name for read/write, but strips
06678  away all C/C++ convention comments in this file. The pointer 
06679  returned will point to a temp file afterwards which will be automatically
06680  removed afterwards. The orginal file  remains unchanged.
06681 
06682  Note: we also strip ';' '=' ':' for easier parsing
06683  
06684  *******************************************************************************
06685  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
06686  
06687  none
06688  
06689  ******************************************************************************/
06690 FILE *
06691 fopen_strip(char *filename)
06692      
06693 {
06694 
06695   enum Comments {
06696     C_NONE,
06697     C_PLAIN,
06698     C_PLUS
06699   };
06700 
06701   FILE *infile, *temp;
06702   int   i,k,rc,last_rc;
06703   int   skip = C_NONE;
06704   int   wait = 2;
06705   int   dummy;
06706 
06707   infile = fopen(filename,"r");
06708   if (infile == NULL)
06709     return NULL;
06710   
06711   // clean away any comment lines as well as commas, semicolons, and equal signs
06712   if ((temp = tmpfile())==NULL) {
06713     fclose(infile);
06714     return NULL;
06715   }
06716   last_rc = EOF;
06717   
06718   
06719   while ((rc=fgetc(infile)) != EOF) {
06720     
06721     --wait;
06722     
06723     if (skip == C_NONE && rc == '*' && last_rc == '/') {
06724       skip = C_PLAIN;
06725     } else if (skip == C_NONE && rc == '/' && last_rc == '/') {
06726       skip = C_PLUS;
06727     } else if (skip == C_PLAIN && rc == '/' && last_rc == '*') {
06728       skip = C_NONE;
06729       wait = 2;
06730     } else if (skip == C_PLUS && rc == '\n') {
06731       skip = C_NONE;
06732       wait = 2;
06733     }
06734     
06735     if (skip == C_NONE && last_rc != EOF && wait <= 0) {
06736       if (last_rc != ';' && last_rc != ',' && last_rc != '=') {
06737         fputc(last_rc,temp);
06738       }
06739     }
06740     
06741     last_rc = rc;
06742     
06743   }
06744   
06745   fputc(last_rc,temp);
06746   fclose(infile);
06747   rewind(temp);
06748 
06749   return temp;
06750 
06751 }
06752 
06753 /*!*****************************************************************************
06754  *******************************************************************************
06755  \note  remove_temp_file
06756  \date  March 94
06757  
06758  \remarks 
06759  
06760  removes the current tempfile
06761  
06762  *******************************************************************************
06763  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
06764  
06765  none
06766  
06767  ******************************************************************************/
06768 void
06769 remove_temp_file(void)
06770      
06771 {
06772   if (strcmp(tempfile,"")!=0) {
06773     remove(tempfile);
06774     strcpy(tempfile,"");
06775   }
06776 }
06777 
06778 /*!*****************************************************************************
06779  *******************************************************************************
06780  \note  fopen_strip_comments
06781  \date  March 94
06782  
06783  \remarks 
06784  
06785  opens a file with a given file name for read/write, but strips
06786  away all C-convention comments in this file. The pointer 
06787  returned will point to a temp.temp file afterwards which
06788  can be inspected or removed afterwards. The orginal file
06789  remains unchanged
06790  
06791  *******************************************************************************
06792  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
06793  
06794  none
06795  
06796  ******************************************************************************/
06797 FILE *
06798 fopen_strip_comments(char *filename)
06799      
06800 {
06801 
06802   FILE *infile, *temp;
06803   int   i,k,rc,last_rc;
06804   int   skip = FALSE;
06805   int   wait = 2;
06806   int   dummy;
06807   int   fd;
06808 
06809 
06810   infile = fopen(filename,"r");
06811 
06812   if (infile == NULL) {
06813 
06814     return NULL;
06815 
06816   }
06817 
06818   /* clean away any comment lines as well as commas and semicolons */
06819 
06820   /*sprintf(tempfile,"%s%ld",TEMPFILE,random_number(0,100000));*/
06821   sprintf(tempfile,"%sXXXXXXXX",TEMPFILE);
06822   if ((fd = mkstemp(tempfile))==-1 ||
06823       (temp = fdopen(fd,"w+"))==NULL) {
06824     strcpy(tempfile,"");
06825     return NULL;
06826   }
06827   last_rc = EOF;
06828   
06829   while ((rc=fgetc(infile)) != EOF) {
06830     
06831     --wait;
06832     
06833     if (rc == '*' && last_rc == '/') {
06834       skip = TRUE;
06835     } else if (rc == '/' && last_rc == '*') {
06836       skip = FALSE;
06837       wait = 2;
06838     }
06839     
06840     if (!skip && last_rc != EOF && wait <= 0) {
06841       if (last_rc != ';' && last_rc != ',')
06842         fputc(last_rc,temp);
06843     }
06844     
06845     last_rc = rc;
06846     
06847   }
06848   
06849   fputc(last_rc,temp);
06850   fclose(infile);
06851   rewind(temp);
06852 
06853   return temp;
06854 
06855 }
06856 
06857 /*!*****************************************************************************
06858  *******************************************************************************
06859  \note  print_mat
06860  \date  August 17, 92
06861  
06862  \remarks 
06863  
06864  just prints the given matrix
06865  
06866  *******************************************************************************
06867  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
06868  
06869  \param[in]     com   : comment
06870  \param[in]     a     : the matrix to be printed
06871  
06872  ******************************************************************************/
06873 void  
06874 print_mat(char *comm, Matrix a)
06875      
06876 {
06877 
06878   int i,j;
06879   int nr,nc;
06880 
06881   nr = a[0][NR];
06882   nc = a[0][NC];
06883 
06884   printf("Matrix >%s< :  [%dx%d] (type=%d)\n",comm,nr,nc,(int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]);
06885 
06886   switch ((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
06887 
06888   case IS_FULL:
06889 
06890     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
06891       printf("          ");
06892       for (j=1; j<=nc; ++j) {
06893         printf("% 8.4f ",a[i][j]);
06894       }
06895       printf("\n");
06896     }
06897     printf("\n");
06898 
06899     break;
06900 
06901 
06902   case IS_DIAG:
06903 
06904     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
06905       printf("          ");
06906       for (j=1; j<=nc; ++j) {
06907         if (i==j) {
06908           printf("% 8.4f ",a[i][j]);
06909         } else {
06910           printf("% 8.4f ",0.0);
06911         }
06912       }
06913       printf("\n");
06914     }
06915     printf("\n");
06916 
06917     break;
06918 
06919 
06920   case IS_SYMM:
06921 
06922     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
06923       printf("          ");
06924       for (j=1; j<=nc; ++j) {
06925         if (i<=j) {
06926           printf("% 8.4f ",a[i][j]);
06927         } else {
06928           printf("% 8.4f ",a[j][i]);
06929         }
06930       }
06931       printf("\n");
06932     }
06933     printf("\n");
06934 
06935     break;
06936 
06937 
06938   default:
06939 
06940     exit(-22);
06941 
06942   }
06943 
06944 }
06945

07000         }

07004     printf("\n");
07005 
07006     break;
07007

07009   case IS_SYMM:

07035 /*!*****************************************************************************
07036  *******************************************************************************
07037  \note  fprint_mat
07038  \date  August 17, 92
07039  
07040  \remarks 
07041  
07042  just prints the given matrix to a file
07043  
07044  *******************************************************************************
07045  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
07046  
07047  \param[in]     fp    : open file pointer
07048  \param[in]     com   : comment
07049  \param[in]     a     : the matrix to be printed
07050  
07051  ******************************************************************************/
07052 void  
07053 fprint_mat(FILE *fp, char *comm, Matrix a)
07054      
07055 {
07056 
07057   int i,j;
07058   int nr,nc;
07059 
07060   nr = a[0][NR];
07061   nc = a[0][NC];
07062 
07063   if (strcmp(comm,"") != 0)
07064     fprintf(fp,"Matrix >%s< :\n",comm);
07065 
07066   switch ((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
07067 
07068   case IS_FULL:
07069 
07070     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
07071       fprintf(fp,"          ");
07072       for (j=1; j<=nc; ++j) {
07073         fprintf(fp,"% 8.4f ",a[i][j]);
07074       }
07075       fprintf(fp,"\n");
07076     }
07077     fprintf(fp,"\n");
07078 
07079     break;
07080 
07081 
07082   case IS_DIAG:
07083 
07084     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
07085       fprintf(fp,"          ");
07086       for (j=1; j<=nc; ++j) {
07087         if (i==j) {
07088           fprintf(fp,"% 8.4f ",a[i][j]);
07089         } else {
07090           fprintf(fp,"% 8.4f ",0.0);
07091         }
07092       }
07093       fprintf(fp,"\n");
07094     }
07095     fprintf(fp,"\n");
07096 
07097     break;
07098 
07099 
07100   case IS_SYMM:
07101 
07102     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
07103       fprintf(fp,"          ");
07104       for (j=1; j<=nc; ++j) {
07105         if (i<=j) {
07106           fprintf(fp,"% 8.4f ",a[i][j]);
07107         } else {
07108           fprintf(fp,"% 8.4f ",a[j][i]);
07109         }
07110       }
07111       fprintf(fp,"\n");
07112     }
07113     fprintf(fp,"\n");
07114 
07115     break;
07116 
07117 
07118   default:
07119 
07120     exit(-22);
07121 
07122   }
07123 
07124 }

07255 /*!*****************************************************************************
07256  *******************************************************************************
07257  \note  fwrite_mat
07258  \date  August 17, 92
07259  
07260  \remarks 
07261  
07262  writes the given matrix as binary to given file pointer
07263  
07264  *******************************************************************************
07265  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
07266  
07267  \param[in]     fp    : an (open) file pointer
07268  \param[in]     a     : the matrix to be written
07269  
07270  ******************************************************************************/
07271 int
07272 fwrite_mat(FILE *fp, Matrix a)
07273      
07274 {
07275 
07276   int i,j;
07277   int nr,nc;
07278   int num;
07279 
07280   nr = a[0][NR];
07281   nc = a[0][NC];
07282 
07283 #ifdef BYTESWAP
07284   for (i=0;i<N_MAT_INFO;++i)
07285     a[0][i]=byteswap_double(a[0][i]);
07286 #endif
07287 
07288   num = N_MAT_INFO;  
07289   if (fwrite(&(a[0][0]),sizeof(double),num,fp)!= num) {
07290     printf( "cannot fwrite matrix.\n" );
07291     return FALSE;
07292   }
07293   
07294 #ifdef BYTESWAP
07295   for (i=0;i<N_MAT_INFO;++i)
07296     a[0][i]=byteswap_double(a[0][i]);
07297   mat_equal_apply_math(a,byteswap_double,a);
07298 #endif
07299 
07300   switch ((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
07301 
07302   case IS_FULL:
07303 
07304     num = a[0][NR]*a[0][NC];
07305     if (fwrite(&(a[1][1]),sizeof(double),num,fp)!= num) {
07306       printf( "cannot fwrite matrix.\n" );
07307       return FALSE;
07308     }
07309 
07310     break;
07311 
07312 
07313   case IS_DIAG:
07314 
07315     num = a[0][NR];
07316     if (fwrite(&(a[1][1]),sizeof(double),num,fp)!= num) {
07317       printf( "cannot fwrite matrix.\n" );
07318       return FALSE;
07319     }
07320 
07321     break;
07322 
07323 
07324   case IS_SYMM:
07325 
07326     num = a[0][NR]*(a[0][NR] + 1)/2;
07327     if (fwrite(&(a[1][1]),sizeof(double),num,fp)!= num) {
07328       printf( "cannot fwrite matrix.\n" );
07329       return FALSE;
07330     }
07331 
07332     break;
07333 
07334 
07335   default:
07336 
07337     exit(-22);
07338 
07339   }
07340 
07341 #ifdef BYTESWAP
07342   mat_equal_apply_math(a,byteswap_double,a);
07343 #endif
07344 
07345   return TRUE;
07346 
07347 }
07348 
07349 /*!*****************************************************************************
07350  *******************************************************************************
07351  \note  fwrite_fmat
07352  \date  April 1999
07353  
07354  \remarks 
07355  
07356  writes the given matrix as binary to given file pointer
07357  
07358  *******************************************************************************
07359  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
07360  
07361  \param[in]     fp    : an (open) file pointer
07362  \param[in]     a     : the matrix to be written
07363  
07364  ******************************************************************************/
07365 int
07366 fwrite_fmat(FILE *fp, fMatrix a)
07367      
07368 {
07369 
07370   int i,j;
07371   int nr,nc;
07372   int num;
07373 
07374   nr = a[0][NR];
07375   nc = a[0][NC];
07376 
07377 #ifdef BYTESWAP
07378   for (i=0;i<N_MAT_INFO;++i)
07379     a[0][i]=byteswap_float(a[0][i]);
07380 #endif
07381 
07382   num = N_MAT_INFO;
07383   if (fwrite(&(a[0][0]),sizeof(float),num,fp)!= num) {
07384     printf( "cannot fwrite matrix.\n" );
07385     return FALSE;
07386   }
07387   
07388 #ifdef BYTESWAP
07389   for (i=0;i<N_MAT_INFO;++i)
07390     a[0][i]=byteswap_float(a[0][i]);
07391   fmat_equal_apply_math(a,byteswap_float,a);
07392 #endif
07393 
07394   switch ((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
07395 
07396   case IS_FULL:
07397 
07398     num = a[0][NR]*a[0][NC];
07399     if (fwrite(&(a[1][1]),sizeof(float),num,fp)!= num) {
07400       printf( "cannot fwrite matrix.\n" );
07401       return FALSE;
07402     }
07403 
07404     break;
07405 
07406 
07407   case IS_DIAG:
07408 
07409     num = a[0][NR];
07410     if (fwrite(&(a[1][1]),sizeof(float),num,fp)!= num) {
07411       printf( "cannot fwrite matrix.\n" );
07412       return FALSE;
07413     }
07414 
07415     break;
07416 
07417 
07418   case IS_SYMM:
07419 
07420     num = a[0][NR]*(a[0][NR] + 1)/2;
07421     if (fwrite(&(a[1][1]),sizeof(float),num,fp)!= num) {
07422       printf( "cannot fwrite matrix.\n" );
07423       return FALSE;
07424     }
07425 
07426     break;
07427 
07428 
07429   default:
07430 
07431     exit(-22);
07432 
07433   }
07434 
07435 #ifdef BYTESWAP
07436   fmat_equal_apply_math(a,byteswap_float,a);
07437 #endif
07438 
07439   return TRUE;
07440 
07441 }
07442 
07443 /*!*****************************************************************************
07444  *******************************************************************************
07445  \note  fread_mat
07446  \date  August 17, 92
07447  
07448  \remarks 
07449  
07450  reads the given matrix as binary to given file pointer
07451  
07452  *******************************************************************************
07453  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
07454  
07455  \param[in]     a     : the matrix to be read
07456  \param[in]     fp    : an (open) file pointer
07457  
07458  ******************************************************************************/
07459 int
07460 fread_mat(FILE *fp, Matrix a)
07461      
07462 {
07463 
07464   int i,j;
07465   int nr,nc;
07466   int num;
07467 
07468   nr = a[0][NR];
07469   nc = a[0][NC];
07470 
07471   num = N_MAT_INFO;
07472   if (fread(&(a[0][0]),sizeof(double),num,fp)!= num) {
07473     printf( "cannot fread matrix.\n" );
07474     return FALSE;
07475   }
07476   
07477 #ifdef BYTESWAP
07478   for (i=0;i<N_MAT_INFO;++i)
07479     a[0][i]=byteswap_double(a[0][i]);
07480 #endif
07481 
07482   switch ((int)a[0][MAT_TYPE]) {
07483 
07484   case IS_FULL:
07485 
07486     num = a[0][NR]*a[0][NC];
07487     if (fread(&(a[1][1]),sizeof(double),num,fp)!= num) {
07488       printf( "cannot fread matrix.\n" );
07489       return FALSE;
07490     }
07491 
07492     break;
07493 
07494 
07495   case IS_DIAG:
07496 
07497     num = a[0][NR];
07498     if (fread(&(a[1][1]),sizeof(double),num,fp)!= num) {
07499       printf( "cannot fread matrix.\n" );
07500       return FALSE;
07501     }
07502 
07503     break;
07504 
07505 
07506   case IS_SYMM:
07507 
07508     num = a[0][NR]*(a[0][NR] + 1)/2;
07509     if (fread(&(a[1][1]),sizeof(double),num,fp)!= num) {
07510       printf( "cannot fread matrix.\n" );
07511       return FALSE;
07512     }
07513 
07514     break;
07515 
07516 
07517   default:
07518 
07519     return FALSE;
07520 
07521   }
07522 
07523 #ifdef BYTESWAP
07524   mat_equal_apply_math(a,byteswap_double,a);
07525 #endif
07526 
07527   return TRUE;
07528 
07529 }

07670 /*!*****************************************************************************

07673  \date  August 17, 92
07674  
07675  \remarks 
07676  
07677  just prints the given vector to a  file
07678  
07679  *******************************************************************************
07680  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
07681  
07682  \param[in]     fp    : open file pointer
07683  \param[in]     com   : comment
07684  \param[in]     a     : the vector to be printed
07685  
07686  ******************************************************************************/
07687 void  
07688 fprint_vec(FILE *fp, char *comm, Vector a)
07689      
07690 {
07691 
07692   int i,j;
07693 
07694   if (strcmp(comm,"")!=0)
07695     fprintf(fp,"Vector >%s< :\n",comm);
07696 
07697   for (i=1; i<=a[NR]; ++i) {
07698     fprintf(fp,"          % 8.4f\n",a[i]);
07699   }
07700   fprintf(fp,"\n");
07701 
07702 }
07703

07739 /*!*****************************************************************************
07740  *******************************************************************************
07741  \note  fwrite_vec
07742  \date  August 17, 92
07743  
07744  \remarks 
07745  
07746  writes vector in binary out to file
07747  
07748  *******************************************************************************
07749  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
07750  
07751  \param[in]     fp    : an (open) file pointer
07752  \param[in]     a     : the vector to be written
07753  
07754  ******************************************************************************/
07755 int
07756 fwrite_vec(FILE *fp, Vector a)
07757      
07758 {
07759   int num;
07760   
07761   num = a[NR]+1;
07762 
07763 #ifdef BYTESWAP
07764   vec_equal_apply_math(a,byteswap_double,a);
07765   a[NR]=byteswap_double(a[NR]);
07766 #endif
07767 
07768   if (fwrite(&(a[0]),sizeof(double),num,fp)!= num) {
07769     printf( "cannot fwrite vector\n" );
07770     return FALSE;
07771   }
07772 
07773 #ifdef BYTESWAP
07774   a[NR]=byteswap_double(a[NR]);
07775   vec_equal_apply_math(a,byteswap_double,a);
07776 #endif
07777 
07778   return TRUE;
07779 
07780 }
07781

07800

07809 #endif
07810 
07811   if (fwrite(&(a[0]),sizeof(int),num,fp)!= num) {
07812     printf( "cannot fwrite vector\n" );
07813     return FALSE;
07814   }
07815 
07816 #ifdef BYTESWAP
07817   a[NR]=byteswap_int(a[NR]);
07818   ivec_equal_apply_math(a,byteswap_int,a);
07819 #endif
07820 
07821   return TRUE;
07822 
07823 }

07833

07839

07841 int
07842 fread_vec(FILE *fp, Vector a)
07843      
07844 {
07845   int num;

07849     printf( "cannot fread vector\n" );
07850     return FALSE;
07851   }
07852 
07853 #ifdef BYTESWAP
07854   a[0]=byteswap_double(a[0]);
07855   vec_equal_apply_math(a,byteswap_double,a);
07856 #endif
07857 
07858   return TRUE;
07859 
07860 }

07893 #endif
07894 
07895   return TRUE;

07965 /*!*****************************************************************************
07966  *******************************************************************************
07967  \note  interpolate
07968  \date  August 17, 92
07969  
07970  \remarks 
07971  
07972  multidimensional interpolation on a grid: given n_dim_in
07973  input dimensions and the vectors of the grid points
07974  as well as a lookup point, the function generates
07975  the multidimensional output (n_dim_out) by means of multi-
07976  linear interpolation
07977  
07978  *******************************************************************************
07979  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
07980  
07981  \param[in]     v_in    : vector with grid points
07982  \param[in]     n_in    : how many input dimensions
07983  \param[in]     v_out   : vector with corresponding output points
07984  \param[in]     n_out   : how many output dimensions
07985  \param[in]     v_q     : the input query point
07986  \param[out]    out     : the interpolated point
07987  
07988  NOTE: the function returns FALSE if query point lies outside
07989  of grid rectangle
07990  
07991  ******************************************************************************/
07992 #define MAX_IN 50
07993 #define MAX_PTS 100
07994 int
07995 interpolate(double **v_in, int n_in, double **v_out, int n_out, 
07996             double *v_q, double *out)
07997      
07998 {
07999 
08000   int i,j,k;
08001   static double *v_max;
08002   static double *v_min;
08003   static double **w;
08004   static int    **bin;
08005   int    n_pts;
08006   static int    *num;
08007   static double *fac;
08008   double aux;
08009   static int max_in = 0, max_pts = 0;
08010 
08011   n_pts = 1 << n_in;  /* n_in and n_pts are coupled */
08012 
08013   /* do we need more working memory */
08014 
08015   if (n_in > max_in) {
08016 
08017     if (max_in != 0) {
08018       my_free_vector(v_max,1,n_in);
08019       my_free_vector(v_min,1,n_in);
08020       my_free_matrix(w,1,n_in,0,1);
08021       my_free_imatrix(bin,1,n_pts,1,n_in);
08022       my_free_ivector(num,1,n_pts);
08023       my_free_vector(fac,1,n_pts);
08024     }
08025 
08026     v_max = my_vector(1,n_in);
08027     v_min = my_vector(1,n_in);
08028     w     = my_matrix(1,n_in,0,1);
08029     bin   = my_imatrix(1,n_pts,1,n_in);
08030     num   = my_ivector(1,n_pts);
08031     fac   = my_vector(1,n_pts);
08032 
08033     max_in = n_in;
08034     max_pts = n_pts;
08035 
08036   }
08037   
08038 
08039   /* determine max an min values of input vector */
08040    
08041   for (j=1; j<=n_in; ++j) {
08042     v_max[j] = -1.e30;
08043     v_min[j] = +1.e30;
08044     for (i=1; i<=n_pts; ++i) {
08045       if (v_in[i][j] > v_max[j]) v_max[j] = v_in[i][j];
08046       if (v_in[i][j] < v_min[j]) v_min[j] = v_in[i][j];
08047     }
08048   }
08049 
08050   /* determine the "weight" of the query point */
08051 
08052   for (i=1; i<=n_in; ++i) {
08053     aux = v_max[i]-v_min[i];
08054     if (fabs(aux) < 1.e-10) aux = macro_sign(aux)*1.e-10;
08055     w[i][1] = (v_q[i] - v_min[i])/aux;
08056     /* this value must be between 0 and 1 */
08057     if (w[i][1] > 1 || w[i][1] < 0) return FALSE;
08058     w[i][0] = 1.-w[i][1];
08059   }
08060 
08061   /* determine the "binary" vector for each grid point */
08062 
08063   for (i=1; i<=n_pts; ++i) {
08064     for (j=1; j<=n_in; ++j) {
08065       if (v_in[i][j] == v_max[j]) {
08066         bin[i][j] = 1;
08067       } else {
08068         bin[i][j] = 0;
08069       }
08070     }
08071   }
08072 
08073   /* some computation can be summerized before the final interpolation */
08074 
08075   for (j=1; j<=n_pts; ++j) {
08076     fac[j] = 1.;
08077     for (k=1; k<=n_in; ++k) {
08078       fac[j] *= w[k][ bin[j][k] ];
08079     }
08080   }
08081   
08082  
08083   /* do the interpolation for every output dimension */
08084 
08085   for (i=1; i<=n_out; ++i) {
08086     out[i] = 0.0;
08087     for (j=1; j<=n_pts; ++j) {
08088       out[i] += v_out[j][i] * fac[j];
08089     }
08090   }
08091 
08092   return TRUE;
08093 
08094 }
08095 
08096 /*!*****************************************************************************
08097  *******************************************************************************
08098  \note  beep
08099  \date  August 17, 92

08104  
08105  *******************************************************************************
08106  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
08107  
08108  none
08109  
08110  ******************************************************************************/
08111 int
08112 beep(int how_many)
08113      
08114 {
08115 
08116   int i;
08117 
08118   for (i=1; i<=how_many; ++i) printf("%c",0x7);
08119   fflush(stdout);
08120   return TRUE;
08121 
08122 }

08124 /*!*****************************************************************************
08125  *******************************************************************************
08126  \note  my_isnan
08127  \date  August 17, 92
08128  
08129  \remarks 
08130  
08131  returns TRUE if given number is an nan
08132  
08133  *******************************************************************************
08134  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
08135  
08136  none
08137  
08138  ******************************************************************************/
08139 int
08140 my_isnan(double x)
08141      
08142 {
08143 
08144   int non_neg = x >= 0.0;
08145   int non_pos = x <= 0.0;
08146   return( !(non_neg || non_pos) );
08147 }
08148 
08149 /*!*****************************************************************************
08150  *******************************************************************************
08151  \note  find_keyword
08152  \date  October, 1995
08153  
08154  \remarks 
08155  
08156  find a key word in the file given by fp and positions the read cursor
08157  right after the keyword
08158  
08159  *******************************************************************************
08160  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
08161  
08162  \param[in]     fp       : file pointer
08163  \param[in]     word     : keyword to be found
08164  
08165  ******************************************************************************/
08166 int
08167 find_keyword(FILE *fp, char *name)
08168 
08169 {
08170 
08171   int  i,j,c;
08172   int  rc = TRUE;
08173   char string[strlen(name)*2];
08174   int  l;
08175   char sep[]={' ','\n',':',',',';','=','\t','\0'};
08176 
08177   rewind(fp);
08178   l  = strlen(name);
08179   i  = 0;
08180 
08181   while (rc != EOF) {
08182 
08183     rc=fgetc(fp);
08184     if ( rc != EOF ) {
08185 
08186       string[i++] = rc;
08187       string[i]   = '\0';
08188 
08189       if ( strstr(string,name) != NULL) {
08190         // wait for one more character to judge whether this string
08191         // has the correct end delimiters
08192         if (strchr(sep,string[i-1]) != NULL) {
08193           // now check for preceeding delimiter
08194 
08195           if (i-l-2 < 0) // this means "name" was the first string in file
08196             return TRUE;
08197           else if (strchr(sep,string[i-l-2]) != NULL) //otherwise check delim
08198             return TRUE;
08199         }
08200       }
08201 
08202       if (i >= 2*l-1) {
08203         strcpy(string,&(string[i-l]));
08204         i = strlen(string);
08205       }
08206 
08207     }
08208 
08209   }
08210 
08211   return FALSE;
08212 
08213 }
08214 
08215   
08216 /*!*****************************************************************************
08217  *******************************************************************************
08218  \note  maxMin
08219  \date  August, 96
08220  
08221  \remarks 
08222  
08223  updates max and min variables from a given value
08224  
08225  *******************************************************************************
08226  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
08227  
08228  \param[in]     x        : the input
08229  \param[in,out] max_x    : the current max, overwritten if needed
08230  \param[in,out] min_x    : the current min, overwritten if needed
08231 
08232 
08233  ******************************************************************************/
08234 void
08235 maxMin(double x, double *max_x, double *min_x)
08236 
08237 {
08238   
08239   if (x > *max_x) *max_x = x;
08240   if (x < *min_x) *min_x = x;
08241 
08242 }
08243 
08244 #ifndef c40  
08245 /*!*****************************************************************************
08246  *******************************************************************************
08247  \note  read_file_bin
08248  \date  October, 1996
08249  
08250  \remarks 
08251  
08252  reads a file, assuming it consists of a certain number of columns,
08253  and splits the columns into input and output columns according to
08254  a sorting index (optional). Every file is also duplicated as a 
08255  binary file, and the binary file is updated whenever the date of
08256  the original file is newer than that of the binary file
08257 
08258  Note: the arrays for input and output are allocated by this function
08259  according to my matrix conventions
08260  
08261  *******************************************************************************
08262  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
08263  
08264  \param[in]     fname    : the filename (without the .bin suffix)
08265  \param[in]     n_col    : number of columns
08266  \param[in]     n_in     : number of inputs
08267  \param[in]     n_out    : number of outputs
08268  \param[in]     ind_in   : index array to map columns to inputs (pass NULL to do 1 to 1)
08269  \param[in]     ind_out  : index array for outputs (analogously as ind_in)
08270  \param[out]    X        : input data
08271  \param[out]    Y        : output data
08272  \param[out]    nrow     : number of rows read
08273  
08274  ******************************************************************************/
08275 int
08276 read_file_bin(char *fname, int n_col, int n_in, int n_out, int *ind_in,
08277               int *ind_out, double ***X, double ***Y, int *nrow)
08278 
08279 {
08280 
08281   int i,j,m,n;
08282   double **XX;
08283   double **YY;
08284   char   string[100];
08285   FILE   *fp;
08286   FILE   *fpbin;
08287   int    create_bin_file = FALSE;
08288   int    ndata=0;
08289   double dummy;
08290   double **data;
08291   int    ind_in_flag = FALSE;
08292   int    ind_out_flag = FALSE;
08293   int    rc;
08294   
08295   /* does the file exist in .bin mode? */
08296 
08297   sprintf(string,"%s.bin",fname);
08298   fpbin = fopen(string,"r");
08299   fp    = fopen(fname,"r");
08300 
08301   if (fp != NULL && fpbin != NULL) {
08302 
08303     struct stat s;
08304     struct stat sbin;
08305 
08306     /* check whether the .bin file is still up to date */
08307 
08308     stat(fname,&s);
08309     stat(string,&sbin);
08310 
08311     if (s.st_mtime > sbin.st_mtime) {
08312       create_bin_file = TRUE;
08313       fclose(fpbin);
08314     } else {
08315       fclose(fp);
08316     }
08317     
08318 
08319   } else if ( fp != NULL && fpbin == NULL ) {
08320 
08321     /* create the .bin file */
08322 
08323     create_bin_file = TRUE;
08324 
08325   } else {  
08326 
08327     /* something is wrong; I do not accept pure .bin files or
08328        missing stuff */
08329     
08330     if (fpbin != NULL) fclose(fpbin);
08331     return FALSE;
08332 
08333   }
08334 
08335 AGAIN:
08336 
08337   /* now sort out what we have to do */
08338 
08339   if (create_bin_file) {
08340 
08341     /* run through the file to count the number of lines */
08342 
08343     ndata = 0;
08344     for (;;) {
08345       if (fscanf(fp,"%lf",&dummy) == EOF)
08346         break;
08347       ++ndata;
08348     }
08349         
08350     rewind(fp);
08351 
08352     if (ndata%n_col != 0) {
08353       printf("Number of columns in file >%s< does not seem to be %d\n",
08354              fname,n_col);
08355       fclose(fp);
08356       return FALSE;
08357     }
08358 
08359     ndata = ndata/n_col;
08360 
08361     /* allocate memory and read the data */
08362 
08363     data = my_matrix(1,ndata,1,n_col);
08364 
08365     for (i=1; i<=ndata; ++i) {
08366       for (j=1; j<=n_col; ++j) {
08367         rc = fscanf(fp,"%lf",&data[i][j]);
08368       }
08369     }
08370 
08371     fclose(fp);
08372 
08373     /* write the bin file */
08374 
08375     if ((fp = fopen(string,"w")) == NULL)
08376       exit(-13);
08377     fprintf(fp,"%d %d\n",ndata,n_col);
08378     fwrite_mat(fp,data);
08379     fclose(fp);
08380 
08381   } else { 
08382     
08383     int iaux;
08384 
08385     /* read the first line of the .bin file */
08386 
08387     iaux = n_col;
08388     rc = fscanf(fpbin,"%d %d",&ndata,&n_col);
08389     if (iaux != n_col) {
08390       printf("Number of columns does not match file: %d != %d\n",
08391              iaux,n_col);
08392       fclose(fpbin);
08393       return FALSE;
08394     }
08395     
08396     data = my_matrix(1,ndata,1,n_col);
08397     fgetc(fpbin);
08398     if (!fread_mat(fpbin,data)) {
08399       /* this might be a binary incompatibility -- just create a new bin file */
08400       my_free_matrix(data,1,ndata,1,n_col);
08401       create_bin_file = TRUE;
08402       fp = fopen(fname,"r");
08403       fclose(fpbin);
08404       goto AGAIN;
08405     }
08406     fclose(fpbin);
08407 
08408   }
08409 
08410   /* now copy the data into the appropriate columns of the X and Y
08411      matrices */
08412 
08413   if (n_in > 0 && ndata > 0) 
08414     XX = my_matrix(1,ndata,1,n_in);
08415   else 
08416     XX = NULL;
08417   if (n_out > 0 && ndata > 0)
08418     YY = my_matrix(1,ndata,1,n_out);
08419   else
08420     YY = NULL;
08421   if (ind_in == NULL && n_in > 0) {
08422     ind_in = my_ivector(1,n_in);
08423     for (i=1; i<=n_in; ++i) ind_in[i]=i;
08424     ind_in_flag = TRUE;
08425   }
08426 
08427   if (ind_out == NULL && n_out > 0) {
08428     ind_out = my_ivector(1,n_out);
08429     for (i=1; i<=n_out; ++i) ind_out[i]=i+n_in;
08430     ind_out_flag = TRUE;
08431   }
08432 
08433   /* map data into X and Y */
08434 
08435   for (i=1; i<=ndata; ++i) {
08436     for (j=1; j<=n_in; ++j)  XX[i][j] = data[i][ind_in[j]];
08437     for (j=1; j<=n_out; ++j) YY[i][j] = data[i][ind_out[j]];
08438   }
08439 
08440   my_free_matrix(data,1,ndata,1,n_col);
08441   if (ind_in_flag) my_free_ivector(ind_in,1,n_in);
08442   if (ind_out_flag) my_free_ivector(ind_out,1,n_out);
08443 
08444   *X = XX;
08445   *Y = YY;
08446   *nrow = ndata;
08447 
08448   return TRUE;
08449 
08450 }
08451 #endif
08452 #ifdef UNIX
08453 /*!*****************************************************************************
08454  *******************************************************************************
08455  \note  getFile
08456  \date  August 17, 92
08457  
08458  \remarks 
08459  
08460  prompts user for a filename and checks the existence of the file
08461  
08462  *******************************************************************************
08463  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
08464  
08465  \param[out]    fname : the name of the file
08466  
08467  ******************************************************************************/
08468 int 
08469 getFile(char *fname)
08470 
08471 {
08472   
08473   FILE *temp;
08474   char temp_name[100];
08475   char response[100];
08476   int rc;
08477   
08478  AGAIN:
08479   printf("\nInput File Name:\n");
08480   if (!get_string("filename\0",fname,temp_name)) return FALSE;
08481   
08482   /* check whether file already exists */
08483 
08484   if (temp_name[0] == '?') {
08485 
08486     rc = system("ls");
08487     goto AGAIN;
08488 
08489   }
08490 
08491   if ((temp = fopen(temp_name,"r")) == NULL) {
08492     
08493     printf("Error: File with file name >%s< does not exist\n",temp_name);
08494     goto AGAIN;
08495 
08496   }
08497 
08498   fclose(temp);
08499   strcpy(fname,temp_name);
08500 
08501   return TRUE;
08502 }
08503 #endif

08505 /*!*****************************************************************************
08506  *******************************************************************************
08507  \note  mat_add_shape
08508  \date  May 1999
08509  
08510  \remarks 
08511  
08512  adds a row to the given matrix
08513 
08514  *******************************************************************************
08515  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
08516 
08517  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
08518  \param[in]     nr              : number of rows to be added
08519  \param[in]     nc              : number of columns to be added 
08520 
08521  ******************************************************************************/
08522 int
08523 mat_add_shape(Matrix *a, int nr, int nc)
08524 {
08525   int      i,j,m;
08526   int      ar,ac;
08527   int      type;
08528   Matrix   temp=NULL,temp2;
08529 
08530   ar   = (*a)[0][NR];
08531   ac   = (*a)[0][NC];
08532   type = (*a)[0][MAT_TYPE];
08533 
08534   /* allocate a new matrix */
08535 
08536   switch (type) {
08537 
08538   case IS_FULL:
08539     temp = my_matrix(1,ar+nr,1,ac+nc);
08540     for (i=1; i<=ar; ++i)
08541       for (j=1; j<=ac; ++j)
08542         temp[i][j] = (*a)[i][j];
08543     break;
08544 
08545   case IS_SYMM:
08546     temp = my_matrix_symm(1,ar+nr,1,ac+nc);
08547     for (i=1; i<=ar; ++i)
08548       for (j=i; j<=ac; ++j)
08549         temp[i][j] = (*a)[i][j];
08550     break;
08551 
08552   case IS_DIAG:
08553     temp = my_matrix_diag(1,ar+nr,1,ac+nc);
08554     for (i=1; i<=ar; ++i)
08555       temp[i][i] = (*a)[i][i];
08556     break;
08557 
08558   default:
08559     exit(-12);
08560 
08561   }
08562 
08563   temp2 = *a;
08564   *a = temp;
08565 
08566   my_free_matrix(temp2,1,ar,1,ac);
08567 
08568   return TRUE;
08569   
08570 }

08724 /*!*****************************************************************************
08725  *******************************************************************************
08726  \note  byteswap
08727  \date  May 2000
08728  
08729  \remarks 
08730  
08731  swaps the bytes of given variable
08732 
08733  *******************************************************************************
08734  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
08735 
08736  \param[in]     ptr              : pointer to the variable to swap
08737  \param[in]     nbytes          : number of bytes to be swapped
08738 
08739  ******************************************************************************/
08740 void
08741 byteswap(char *ptr, size_t n_bytes)
08742 {
08743   int      i,j;
08744   short    c[100];;
08745 
08746   for (i=0; i<n_bytes; ++i)
08747     c[i] = ptr[i];
08748 
08749   j = n_bytes;
08750   for (i=0; i<n_bytes; ++i)
08751     ptr[--j] = c[i];
08752 
08753 }
08754 double
08755 byteswap_double(double var)
08756 {
08757   byteswap((char *)&var,sizeof(double));
08758   return var;
08759 }
08760 float
08761 byteswap_float(float var)
08762 {
08763   byteswap((char *)&var,sizeof(float));
08764   return var;
08765 }
08766 int
08767 byteswap_int(int var)
08768 {
08769   byteswap((char *)&var, sizeof(int));
08770   return var;
08771 }

08773 /*!*****************************************************************************
08774  *******************************************************************************
08775   \note  clmcplot_convert
08776   \date  June 1999
08777 
08778   \remarks 
08779 
08780   reads an CLMCPLOT file and returns the relevant variables. All relevant
08781   memory is allocated if D, vnames, units are initialized with the NULL
08782   pointer. Otherwise we assume enough memory is available.
08783 
08784  *******************************************************************************
08785  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
08786 
08787  \param[in]     fname     : filename of file to be read
08788  \param[out]    D         : data matrix
08789  \param[out]    vnames    : names of data columns
08790  \param[out]    units     : units of data columns
08791  \param[out]    freq      : sampling frequency of data
08792  \param[out]    n_cols    : number of columns
08793  \param[out]    n_rows    : number of rows
08794 
08795   returns TRUE if successful, otherwise FALSE
08796 
08797  ******************************************************************************/
08798 int
08799 mrdplot_convert(char *fname, Matrix *D, char ***vnames, char ***units, 
08800                 double *freq, int *n_cols, int *n_rows)
08801 {
08802   return clmcplot_convert(fname, D, vnames, units, freq, n_cols, n_rows);
08803 }
08804 
08805 int
08806 clmcplot_convert(char *fname, Matrix *D, char ***vnames, char ***units, 
08807                 double *freq, int *n_cols, int *n_rows)
08808 {
08809   int     j,i,r;
08810   FILE   *fp;
08811   int     buffer_size;
08812   fMatrix buff;
08813   int     aux;
08814   int     rc;
08815 
08816   /* open the file, and parse the parameters */
08817   fp = fopen(fname,"r");
08818   if (fp == NULL)
08819     return FALSE;
08820   
08821   /* get the number of rows, columns, sampling frequency
08822      and calc the buffer_size */
08823   rc = fscanf(fp,"%d %d %d %lf",&buffer_size,n_cols,n_rows,freq);
08824 
08825   /* alocate memory for the array variables if needed */
08826   if (*vnames == NULL) 
08827     *vnames = (char **)my_calloc(*n_cols+1, sizeof(char *), MY_STOP);
08828   if (*units == NULL)
08829     *units = (char **)my_calloc(*n_cols+1, sizeof(char *), MY_STOP);
08830 
08831   for (i=1;i<= *n_cols;++i){
08832     (*vnames)[i] = (char *) my_calloc(40, sizeof(char), MY_STOP);
08833     (*units)[i]  = (char *) my_calloc(40, sizeof(char), MY_STOP);
08834     rc= fscanf(fp, "%s %s", (*vnames)[i], (*units)[i]);
08835   }
08836 
08837   /* there are two extra blank chrs at the end of the block
08838      and a line return which we must account for */
08839   fgetc(fp);
08840   fgetc(fp);
08841   fgetc(fp);
08842   
08843   /* read file into a buffer and check if the matrix size is correct */  
08844   buff = my_fmatrix(1,*n_rows,1,*n_cols);
08845   if (*D == NULL)
08846     *D = my_matrix(1,*n_rows,1,*n_cols);
08847   
08848   if (fread(&buff[1][1],sizeof(float),*n_rows * *n_cols,fp)!= *n_rows * *n_cols){
08849     printf("cannot fread matrix. \n");
08850     return MY_ERROR;
08851   }
08852 
08853 #ifdef BYTESWAP
08854   /* convert little-endian to big-endian */ 
08855   for (j=1; j<=*n_cols; ++j) {
08856     for (i=1; i<=*n_rows; ++i) {
08857       aux = LONGSWAP(*((int *)&(buff[i][j])));
08858       buff[i][j] = *((float *)&aux);
08859     }
08860   }
08861 #endif
08862   
08863   fclose(fp);
08864 
08865   /* copy data into D matrix */
08866   for (j=1; j<=*n_cols; ++j) {
08867     for (i=1; i<=*n_rows; ++i) {
08868       (*D)[i][j] = (double) buff[i][j];
08869     }
08870   }
08871 
08872   /* free up memory by deallocating resources */
08873   my_free_fmatrix (buff,1,*n_rows,1,*n_cols);
08874   
08875   return TRUE;
08876   
08877 }
08878 
08879 
08880 /*!*****************************************************************************
08881  *******************************************************************************
08882 \note  clmcplot_gen
08883 \date  March 2006
08884    
08885 \remarks 
08886 
08887         writes clmcplot data file 
08888 
08889  *******************************************************************************
08890  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
08891 
08892  \param[in]     fname     : filename of file to be read
08893  \param[in]     D         : data matrix
08894  \param[in]     vnames    : names of data columns
08895  \param[in]     units     : units of data columns
08896  \param[in]     freq      : sampling frequency of data
08897  \param[in]     n_cols    : number of columns
08898  \param[in]     n_rows    : number of rows
08899 
08900 
08901  ******************************************************************************/
08902 int
08903 mrdplot_gen(char *fname, Matrix D, char **vnames, char **units, 
08904             double freq, int n_cols, int n_rows) 
08905 {
08906   return clmcplot_gen(fname, D, vnames, units,freq,n_cols,n_rows);
08907   
08908 }
08909 int
08910 clmcplot_gen(char *fname, Matrix D, char **vnames, char **units, 
08911             double freq, int n_cols, int n_rows)
08912 {
08913   int     j,i,r;
08914   FILE   *fp;
08915   int     buffer_size;
08916   fMatrix buffer;
08917   int     aux;
08918 
08919   // open the file, and write all data
08920   if ( (fp = fopen( fname, "w" )) == NULL )  {
08921     printf( "cannot fopen file %s for write.\n", fname );
08922     return FALSE;
08923   }
08924 
08925   // create a floating point buffer and copy all data over
08926   buffer = my_fmatrix(1,n_rows,1,n_cols);
08927   for (i=1; i<=n_rows; ++i)
08928     for (j=1; j<=n_cols; ++j)
08929       buffer[i][j] = D[i][j];
08930   
08931   // write the the buffer size, the number of columns, the sampling time, 
08932   // the column names and units
08933   buffer_size = n_rows*n_cols;
08934   fprintf(fp,"%d  %d  %d  %f\n",buffer_size, n_cols, n_rows, freq);
08935 
08936   for (i=1; i<=n_cols; ++i) {
08937 
08938     if (strcmp(vnames[i],"")==0)
08939       sprintf(vnames[i],"C%d",i);
08940     fprintf(fp,"%s  ",vnames[i]);
08941 
08942     if (strcmp(units[i],"")==0)
08943       sprintf(vnames[i],"-");
08944     fprintf(fp,"%s  ",units[i]);
08945 
08946   }
08947   fprintf(fp,"\n");
08948 
08949 #ifdef BYTESWAP
08950   /* convert little-endian to big-endian */ 
08951   for (j=1; j<=n_cols; ++j) {
08952     for (i=1; i<=n_rows; ++i) {
08953       aux = LONGSWAP(*((int *)&(buffer[i][j])));
08954       buffer[i][j] = *((float *)&aux);
08955     }
08956   }
08957 #endif
08958 
08959   if (fwrite(&(buffer[1][1]),sizeof(float),n_rows*n_cols,fp)!= n_rows*n_cols) {
08960     printf( "cannot fwrite matrix.\n" );
08961     return FALSE;
08962   }
08963 
08964   fclose( fp );
08965 
08966   return TRUE;
08967 
08968 }
